sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5852 (S26W69) WAS STABLE, BUT REMAINED MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND SHOWED NO SIGNS OF DECAY. REGIONS 5858 (S18W27) AND 5864 (N15E31) GREW SLIGHTLY. THE SAME WAS TRUE OF REGION 5854 (N23W53), WHICH WAS THE MOST ACTIVE REGION ON THE DISK (RELATIVELY SPEAKING). THE REGION PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. NEW REGION 5867 (S23W43) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE. REGION 5852 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AN M-CLASS FLARE. THE REGION PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE. REGION 5858 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. MINOR STORMING OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES AFTER 01/0900Z.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  REGION 5874 (S15E18) PRODUCED AN M1/1N LONG-DURATION FLARE THAT MAXED AT 1314 UT, AS WELL AS TWO OTHER SMALL C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES. REGION 5874 IS MODERATELY MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX BUT HAS REMAINED STABLE IN WHITE LIGHT SINCE YESTERDAY. NEW REGION 5878 ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB AS A SIMPLE H-TYPE SPOT. IT IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5836, AND ITS EAST LIMB PASSAGE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR SURGING.  TWO FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES WERE OBSERVED - ONE IN THE NORTHEAST AND ANOTHER IN THE SOUTHWEST.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE BASED SOLELY ON THE FLARE POTENTIAL IN REGION 5874.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL 08/1433 UT WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 18 NT WAS OBSERVED AT BOULDER.  SINCE THAT TIME THE MAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT BOTH MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS UNIDENTIFIED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THROUGH MIDDAY ON 9 JAN, ALTHOUGH PERIODS OF STORM LEVEL CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY AT HIGH LATITUDES.  GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY IS THEN EXPECTED TO TREND DOWNWARDS TOWARD QUIET CONDITIONS BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

REGIONS 5919 (N08W06) AND 5920 (N14W12) HAVE SHOWN MODEST GROWTH IN PLAGE COVERAGE AND SPOT AREA WITH AN INCREASE IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY NOTED IN REGION 5919 WHICH HAS ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL SUB FLARES THIS PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. A VERY SLOW RISING X-RAY ENHANCEMENT BEGAN ABOUT 1800Z AND CONTINUES AT THIS WRITING. THE PEAK SO FAR IS C3. THIS MAY BE RELATED TO A SLOWLY CHANGING, VERY TENUOUS PROMINENCE LOCATED NEAR N45 AT EAST LIMB. A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP AT 2019Z WAS REPORTED BY TWO OBSERVATORIES. ELSEWHERE, THE FIVE SPOTTED REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE STABLE OR DECAYING, AND THE 10.7 CM. RADIO FLUX DROPPED AGAIN. TODAY'S VALUE OF 151 IS THE LOWEST SINCE 04 DECEMBER 1988.

sections.text: CONTINUE LOW. MODERATE LEVELS COULD BE REACHED IN THE NEXT 72 HOURS IF THE LONGITUDES NOW AT EAST LIMB PROVE TO HAVE SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 X-RAY FLARE WAS DETECTED BY GOES AT 1833Z. THIS VERY IMPULSIVE FLARE WAS NOT SEEN BY ANY OBSERVATORY ON THE SUN AT THAT TIME. sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ACTIVITY CONTINUES TO CON- SIST OF FREQUENT RADIO BURSTS AND SWEEPS AND OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES. REGION 5927 (N18W02) CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK AS THE LARGEST GROUP AND IS SHOWING SOME GROWTH. THE REGION PRO- DUCED A C1/SN FLARE FROM 0043-0105Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH TWO SERIES OF RADIO BURSTS, BOTH OF WHICH WERE TENFLARES (10CM BURST GREATER THAN 100% ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVEL). REGION 5930 (N12W29) ALSO SHOWED A GROWTH TREND DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5927 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR FLARES, ALTHOUGH REGION 5930 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5930 (N12W41) PRO- DUCED TWO UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES TODAY: A C5/SF AT 1254Z AND A C6/1F AT 1745Z. THIS GROUP APPEARS TO BE IN A NEW GROWTH PHASE AS NEW SPOTS AND SIGNIFICANT PENUMBRAL GROWTH WERE NOTED. REGION 5927 (N17W15), STILL THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK, COULD ONLY PRODUCE A SINGLE SUBFLARE, AND APPEARS TO BE ENTERING A GRADUAL DECAY PHASE AT THIS TIME. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THE PRINCIPAL THREATS FOR FLARES ARE REGIONS 5930 AND 5927. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS. AN INCREASE IN BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY AS THE LONGITUDES ASSOCIATED WITH OLD REGION 5900 (S10, L-339) WILL BE RETURNING AT THAT TIME. OLD REGION 5900 WAS THE ONLY REGION TO PRODUCE A A MAJOR FLARE IN THE LAST TWO WEEKS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. LEVELS WERE GENERALLY UNSETTLED UNTIL A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 0320Z. THE IMPULSE WAS FOLLOWED BY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS UNTIL ABOUT 1200Z, AFTER WHICH LEVELS RETURNED TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. THE ACTIVITY WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY FILAMENTS WHICH DISAPPEARED ON 10 FEBRUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  THE LARGEST EVENTS WERE SMALL C FLARES, ONE A C1.2 AT 0734UT, WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A DSF AT N50W30.  SEVERAL SMALL REGIONS ARE ROTATING OVER THE SOUTH- EAST LIMB ACCOMPANIED BY SURGE ACTIVITY.  ALL REGIONS APPEAR STABLE OR DECLINING.  PROMINENCES NEAR NW40 AND SE35 HAVE BEEN ACTIVE.  A LARGE EAST-WEST ORIENTATED CORONAL HOLE IS CENTERED NEAR N22E10.  THERE HAS BEEN EVIDENCE FOR A CORONAL HOLE NEAR THIS LOCATION SINCE 0CTOBER 1989.  THERE MAY BE ANOTHER CORONAL HOLE CENTERED NEAR N20E55.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE THAT THE FIELD WILL AGAIN BE DISTURBED LATE IN THE PERIOD AS A CONSEQUENCE OF THE CORONAL HOLE AND DSF ACTIVITY REPORTED IN IA.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5947 (S17E36) PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 22/1454Z ASSOCIATED WITH MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS. THIS REGION DISPLAYED A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN MAGNETIC STRUCTURE DEVELOPING A DELTA CONFIGURATION WITHIN ITS CENTRAL PENUMBRAL MASS. GRADUAL GROWTH CONTINUED IN REGIONS 5942 (S35E16) AND 5946 (N03W22) AND BEGAN IN REGION 5948 (N16E41). REGION 5948 PRODUCED OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES. NEW REGIONS 5953 (S11E59) AND 5954 (S14W47) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5947 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES. THIS REGION PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY GIVEN ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE AURORAL LATITUDES REPORTED MINOR STORM LEVELS FROM 22/1200-1800Z. THE ORIGIN OF THE STORMING MAY BE A CORONAL HOLE CURRENTLY LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5947 (S15E23) INCREASED SLIGHTLY IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY MAINTAINING A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION WITHIN ITS CENTRAL PENUMBRAL STRUCTURE. IT PRODUCED AN M2/2B FLARE AT 23/1259Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM, A SMALL FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE, AND MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 5953 (S09E47) PRODUCED AN M1/SN FLARE AT 23/1635Z. REGION 5948 (N19E28) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN AREAL AND MAGNETIC ASPECTS, BUT WAS FAIRLY STABLE DURING THE PERIOD. NEW REGIONS 5955 (S17E46) AND 5956 (N21E03) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5947 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION AS WELL. REGION 5948 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD REACHED MAJOR STORM LEVELS FROM 23/1200-1800Z. THE CAUSE OF THE STORMING MAY HAVE BEEN A LARGE FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE WHICH OCCURRED ON LATE 19 FEBRUARY/EARLY 20 FEBRUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO THE CONTINUING EFFECTS OF THE FILAMENT MENTIONED ABOVE COMBINED WITH POSSIBLE EFFECTS OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5953 (S09E33) PRODUCED THE PERIOD'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/SF AT 24/0321Z. THIS REGION DISPLAYED GROWTH THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THE SAME WAS TRUE OF REGIONS 5948 (N16E13) AND 5955 (S17E59). REGION 5948 WAS THE MOST ACTIVE GROUP PRODUCING SEVERAL SMALL FLARES INCLUDING A C9/1N AT 23/2351Z. REGION 5947 (S16E09) WAS RELATIVELY QUIET DESPITE ITS MODERATELY COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. NEW REGIONS 5957 (S22E24) AND 5958 (S20E83) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5947 IS THE PRINCIPAL THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARING BY VIRTUE OF ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. IT ALSO DISPLAYS POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 5948 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGHER LATITUDES EXPERIENCED SOME PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING WHICH MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY A FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE DECLINING TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE FINAL DAY OF THE PERIOD. THE ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5947 (S16W04) PRODUCED TWO LOW LEVEL C-FLARES. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO BE MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX BUT IS BEGINNING TO DECAY WITH FRAGMENTATION IN ITS SPOT STRUCTURE NOTED. REGION 5948 (N16W00) HAS REMAINED GENERALLY STABLE WITH ONLY SLIGHT DECAY NOTED. REGION 5953 (S09E20) PRODUCED TWO C-CLASS EVENTS AND SEVERAL SUBFLARES. A C3/SF AT 25/0745Z FROM REGION 5946 (N04W62) WAS THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5947 WITH ITS COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE REMAINS THE BEST CANDIDATE FOR M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY WITH ISOLATED MAJOR EVENTS POSSIBLE. REGION 5948 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, POSSIBLY DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE. PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING WERE OBSERVED AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5947 (S15W16) CONTINUES TO SHOW SLOW DECAY IN ITS LEADING PORTION WITH SOME RELAXING OF ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THIS REGION PRODUCED THE MAJORITY OF THE PERIODS ACTIVITY WITH A C4/SF AT 26/0433Z ASSOCIATED WITH STRONG RADIO EMISSIONS IN THE 245-410 MHZ RANGE. REGION 5948 (N17W13) CONTINUED TO DECAY. REGION 5960 (N13E42) IS GROWING RAPIDLY WITH OCCASIONAL WEAK FLARING NOTED. AN UNCORRELATED C8 X-RAY EVENT WITH STRONG RADIO EMISSIONS AT 26/1625Z WAS THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5947 (S17W29) AND 5961 (N30E51) CONTRIBUTED THE MAJORITY OF C-CLASS EVENTS TODAY, MANY OF WHICH WERE ASSOCIATED WITH STRONG RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 5947 SHOWED ONLY SLIGHT DECAY, MOST NOTABLY IN THE FORM OF PENEUMBRAL FRAGMENTATION. THE REGION REMAINS THE MOST MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX, HOWEVER IT IS SLOWLY WEAKENING. REGION 5961 HAS GROWN RAPIDLY SINCE ITS EMERGENCE WITH OCCASIONAL SURGING NOTED. REGION 5960 (N12E29) SHOWED SLIGHT GROWTH IN ITS SPOT STRUCTURE. REGION 5948 (N17W24) IS DECAYING RAPIDLY NOW MOSTLY IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THE REGION. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS A C7/1N FLARE AT 27/0708Z FROM REGION 5947. REGION 5962 (S25W78) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5947 CONTINUES TO DISPLAY THE BEST POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY. RAPIDLY DEVELOPING REGION 5961 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT LATER IN THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5961 (N30E38) CONTINUED TO GROW RAPIDLY THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD INCREASING IN SPOT AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. AS A RESULT, THE REGION PRODUCED FOUR M-LEVEL EVENTS. AN M1/1F AT 27/2338Z AND AN M2/SF AT 28/0522Z. THE LAST TWO M-CLASS EVENTS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SAME LONG DURATION OPTICAL FLARE. THE FIRST M1 PEAK WAS AT 28/1548Z AND THE SECOND AT 28/1818Z. THE OPTICAL LEVEL OF THE FLARE WAS 2N. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED A C3/2F FLARE AT 28/1013Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. REGION 5947 (S16W42) CONTINUED TO DECLINE PRODUCING ONLY OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. REGION 5960 (N12E15) CONTINUED TO GROW IN SPOT AREA. SURGING WAS NOTED PERIODICALLY ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH THE TREND TOWARDS HIGH LEVELS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. REGION 5961 HAS GOOD POTENTIAL FOR CONTINUED M-CLASS EVENTS WITH ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES POSSIBLE. REGION 5947 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY LEVELS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. HIGH LATITUDES MAY EXPERIENCE PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. EPISODES OF MINOR STORMING OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES EARLY IN THE PERIOD. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 19/0705Z AND WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE MAXIMUM GREATER THAN 10 MEV FLUX OBSERVED THUS FAR WAS 620 PFU AT 19/2035Z. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN AT 19/1015Z AND REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 9.1 DB AT 19/1615Z. IT REMAINED IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. BOTH EVENTS WERE A RESULT OF TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE SHOCK FROM TODAY'S FLARE SHOULD REACH EARTH LATE ON 21 MARCH AFTER WHICH TIME MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING IS EXPECTED. BOTH THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH TOMORROW.

sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5983 (S33E44) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 20/1522Z. THIS REGION WAS IN A PERIOD OF GRADUAL GROWTH. REGION 5988 (S04E62) PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 20/2016Z. REGION 5974 (S33W06) QUICKLY FOLLOWED PRODUCING AN M2/1B FLARE AT 20/2027Z. NEITHER OF THESE FLARES WERE ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 5974 CONTINUED TO GRADUALLY INCREASE IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. 5969 (N32W64) WAS QUIET AND STABLE AS IT APPROACHED THE LIMB. NEW REGION 5990 (N12W22) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 5969, 5974, 5983, AND 5988 ARE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS ACTIVITY. REGION 5974 ALSO PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WERE RECORDED AT HIGH LATITUDES LATE IN THE PERIOD. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 19/0705Z REACHED A MAXIMUM FLUX OF 950 PFU AT 19/2315Z AND REMAINED IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 19/1015Z REACHED ITS MAXIMUM OF 9.1 DB AT 19/1615Z. IT TOO WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE SUMMARY PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF YESTERDAY'S X-FLARE. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE FINAL DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. BOTH THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO END TOMORROW.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE SEVERE STORMING OCCURRED DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5988 (S06W37) PRODUCED AN M4/2N FLARE THAT ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 0751Z. THIS LONG-LIVED EVENT INCLUDED A RADIO BURST OF 290 FLUX UNITS AT 10 CM AND OTHER SIMILAR SIZED BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. THE EVENT WAS DEVOID OF TYPES II OR IV ACTIVITY. STRUCTURALLY THE REGION HAS SHOWN LITTLE CHANGE DURING THE INTERVAL. OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY INCLUDED AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE NEAR N56 W90 AND A BRIGHT SURGE NEAR N17W90. ONE NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED, 5998 (S16E14).

sections.text: MODERATE. BOTH REGIONS 5988 AND 5984 (S13W70) HAVE SHOWN THE ABILITY TO PRODUCE M-LEVEL ACTIVITY. ALSO REGION 5991 (N23W67) MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT. IT PRODUCED FREQUENT SUBFLARES AS IT DOUBLED IN SIZE DURING THE INTERVAL.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6001 (N21E35) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1N AT 1706Z. THE FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODEST DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. A NEW, HOT ACTIVE REGION IS ROTATING ONTO THE DISK AT N28 (EAST LIMB) AND WAS ASSIGNED SESC NUMBER 6007. THIS REGION PRODUCED TWO MAJOR FLARES DURING THE PERIOD: AN M7 AT 0842Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH LOOPS OUT TO .08 RADII, WITH WEAK RADIO BURSTS AT LOW FREQUENCIES AND STRONG BURSTS AT HIGH FREQUENCIES, AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP; AND AN X1/1N AT 1726Z ASSOCIATED WITH BRIGHT SURGING ON THE LIMB, MODERATE TO STRONG RADIO BURSTS (GENERALLY STRONGER AT HIGHER FREQUENCIES) AND A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP. THE REGION'S LATITUDE SUGGESTS THAT IT IS IN THE VICINITY OF OLD REGION 5969. REGION 6001 (N21E23) CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE VISIBLE DISK IN SIZE AND PRODUCED A FEW UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS RELATIVELY STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. ADDITIONAL ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 6007. REGION 6001 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE SOME M-LEVEL FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6007 (N23E67) PRO- DUCED A MAJOR FLARE (M7/SN) AT 1338Z. THE EVENT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH LOOPS, MODERATE RADIO BURSTS, AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP. THE REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL UPPER LEVEL C-FLARES DURING THE PERIOD, BUT HAS BEEN REMARKABLY CALM SINCE THE M7 FLARE . OB- SERVATIONS SO FAR INDICATE THAT THE GROUP IS SURPRISINGLY SMALL, WITH AN AREA OF ABOUT 270 MILLIONTHS IN A SIMPLE, D-TYPE CON- FIGURATION. THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK CONTINUES TO BE 6001 (N21E10), WHICH PRODUCED A FEW LOW LEVEL C-FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. ACTIVE SURGING WAS REPORTED ON THE EAST LIMB AT S43, SUGGESTING THAT AN ADDITIONAL REGION MAY ROTATE INTO VIEW IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS RELATIVELY QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE PRINCIPAL THREAT FOR ACTIVITY IS REGION 6007, ALTHOUGH REGION 6001 MIGHT ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6017 (N22E18) ENTERED A PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANT GROWTH AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C2 AT 11/1556Z. REGION 6007 (N22W18) CONTINUED TO DECAY. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED TYPE II SWEEP OCCURRED AT 11/0749Z; REPORTED SHOCK SPEEDS RANGED FROM 600-1000 KM/SEC. TWO NEW A-TYPE REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6019 (N33W62) AND 6020 (N04E15).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. C-CLASS SUBFLARE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6007 AND 6017. REGION 6017 ALSO PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE REGISTERING 69 NANOTESLA WAS RECORDED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER AT 11/0533Z. THE STORMING MAY BE A CONSEQUENCE OF A 48 DEGREE FILAMENT WHICH DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT SOMETIME BETWEEN 5-6 APRIL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT ACTIVE LEVELS AT HIGHER LATITUDES. PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING MAY OCCUR DURING THE FIRST HALF OF TOMORROW AS THE PRESENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M3 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 12/0259Z. THERE WAS NO OPTICAL CORRELATION FOR THIS BURST. REGION 6017 (N21E04) STABILIZED AND PRODUCED ISOLATED SUBFLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C2/SF AT 12/1830Z. NEW REGION 6022 (N28E72) ROTATED INTO VIEW. sections.text: LOW. C-CLASS SUBFLARE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6007 (N22W27), 6017, AND 6022. REGION 6017 ALSO PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE STORMING MAY BE A CONSEQUENCE OF A 48 DEGREE FILAMENT WHICH DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT SOMETIME BETWEEN 5-6 APRIL. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6021 (S15E68) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY: A C9/SN AT 13/0039Z. STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSION HAS BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GROWING REGION. THE SAME WAS TRUE OF REGION 6022 (N30E67) WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL FLARES INCLUDING A C6/2F AT 13/1840Z. THERE IS SOME EVIDENCE OF A POSSIBLE DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THIS REGION. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C5 X-RAY FLARE OCCURRED AT 13/0508Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP (ESTIMATED SHOCK SPEED 2500 KM/SEC). AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE ON LIMB (EPL) OCCURRED NEAR S54E90 AT 13/1123Z; ANOTHER OCCURRED NEAR S27W90 AT 13/1447Z. NEW REGION 6024 (S08E33) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6022 APPEARS TO BE THE GREATEST THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARES. THIS REGION ALSO PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGIONS 6017 (N22W08) AND 6021 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AS WELL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. MINOR TO SEVERE STORMING WAS OBSERVED AT HIGHER LATITUDES. A DISCRETE SOURCE FOR THIS CONTINUED STORMING HAS NOT YET BEEN DETERMINED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGHER LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY DECLINING TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE BALANCE OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6018 (S33E29) PRODUCED AN M4/1B FLARE AT 13/2127Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 14/0355Z AND AN M1/SN AT 14/1231Z. PLAGE REGION 6007 (N22W53), A FORMER MAJOR FLARE PRODUCER, SHOWED IT STILL HAD SOME LIFE BY PRODUCING A C9/SF FLARE AT 14/0241Z. REGION 6022 (N29E53) CONTINUED TO GROW IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. IT PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6021 (S15E57) ALSO GREW AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. A WEAK, OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED TYPE IV SWEEP OCCURRED AT 14/0412Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE (TO .44 RV) WAS OBSERVED NEAR N28E90 AT 14/1429Z. NEW REGION 6025 (N13E35) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE CAUSE OF THE STORMING REMAINS A MYSTERY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6022 (N32E39) PRODUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 15/0302Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MAJOR RADIO BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM INCLUDING AN 11000 SFU TENFLARE AND TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM WAS ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO DISPLAY SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN MAGNETIC AND WHITE LIGHT ASPECTS. REGION 6018 (S33E16) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH AS WELL PRODUCING SEVERAL FLARES INCLUDING AN M1/SF AT 15/1158Z. REGION 6021 (S15E44) ALSO GREW SIGNIFICANTLY PRODUCING ISOLATED SUBFLARES. NEW REGIONS 6026 (N11W05) AND 6027 (N13E08), BOTH NONDESCRIPT BIPOLES, WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6022 IS EASILY CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGIONS 6018 AND 6021 MAY EACH PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. BOTH REGIONS ALSO PROVIDE A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ISOLATED INTERVALS OF MINOR STORMING OCCURRED AT MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW INCREASING TO ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE BALANCE OF THE PERIOD. TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE MAY BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FIELD ON THE 17TH. AN ISOLATED NORTHERN HEMISPHERE CORONAL HOLE, PRESENTLY STRADDLING CENTRAL MERIDIAN, WILL BE IN A POSITION TO BEGIN AFFECTING THE FIELD ON 18 APRIL. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV MAY OCCUR FROM TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6021 (S14E32) PRODUCED AN X2/2B TENFLARE AT 16/0634Z WITH ASSOCIATED MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP. STRONG RADIO BURST EMISSIONS IN THE UPPER PORTION OF THE SPECTRUM ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT. THE REGION CONTINUES TO GROW IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY. A C6/SN FLARE WAS ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD. REGION 6022 (N31E27) REMAINS THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPLEX REGION ON THE DISK. SOME GROWTH HAS BEEN NOTED TODAY ALONG WITH OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES AND A C3/SF EVENT OBSERVED AT 16/0414Z. REGION 6018 (S32E06) PRODUCED AN M2/2B FLARE AT 16/0042Z. LITTLE CHANGE IN THE SIZE OR COMPLEXITY OF THIS REGION WAS NOTED. REGION 6012 (N31W60) PRODUCED A C9/SN FLARE AT 15/2356Z. AN EVENT LEVEL BRIGHT SURGE ON THE NORTHWEST LIMB WAS OBSERVED AT 16/1512Z ASSOCIATED WITH DEPARTING REGION 6007 (N22W79). NEW REGIONS 6028 (S08E24) AND 6029 (N25E76) WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6021 AND 6022 ARE BOTH CAPABLE OF MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 6018 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE ADDITIONAL ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV HAVE BEEN SLIGHTLY ELEVATED ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVELS THIS PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE RECENT X-CLASS FLARE EVENTS. LEVELS SO FAR HAVE REMAINED WELL BELOW ALERT CRITERIA.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT THREE DAY'S WITH THE EFFECT'S FROM TODAY'S X2/2B FLARE POSSIBLE BY 18 APRIL. AN ISOLATED NORTHERN HEMISPHERE CORONAL HOLE MAY ALSO ADD TO ACTIVITY LEVELS STARTING 18 APRIL. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON'S SHOULD SLOWLY RETURN TO BACKGROUND LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6022 (N31E13) PRODUCED THE SOLE M-CLASS FLARE OF THE PERIOD: AN M1/2N EVENT AT 17/1434Z. THE REGION REMAINS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX WITH GROWTH IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THE REGION NOTED. REGION 6021 (S13E19) ALSO EXHIBITED SLIGHT GROWTH. A C4/SF FLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP WAS OBSERVED AT 17/1629Z. A DECLINE IN SPOT AREA WAS NOTED WITH REGION 6018 (S32W08). NONE THE LESS, THIS REGION PRODUCED THE MAJORITY OF THE DAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY WITH A C5/SF FLARE AT 17/1602Z THE LARGEST. UNCORRELATED ACTIVITY INCLUDED A C9 X-RAY EVENT AT 17/0322Z AND A MINOR TYPE II SWEEP AT 17/1708Z. NEW REGIONS 6030 (N22E33) AND 6031 (S20E50) WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6021 AND 6022 REMAIN THE BEST CANDIDATES FOR MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION WITH REGION 6018 A POSSIBLE SOURCE FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 45 NANOTESLAS WAS OBSERVED AT 17/0719Z. THE X1/2B FLARE NOTED 15/0302Z WAS A LIKELY SOURCE. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN 17/0500Z, REACHED A PEAK OF 12 PROTONS/CM2-S-STER AT 17/0655Z, AND ENDED AT 17/0715Z. ALSO IN RESPONSE TO THE RECENT X-CLASS FLARING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BECOME INCREASINGLY DISTURBED WITH MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING EXPECTED THE FIRST DAY. THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD SHOULD BE CHARACTERIZED BY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV REMAIN ENHANCED AND MAY EXCEED ALERT CRITERIA WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN M1/1N FLARE AT 18/0400Z FROM REGION 6018 (S31W22). THIS REGION HAS BECOME MORE COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY WHILE DECAYING IN SIZE. SEVERAL MINOR SUBFLARES WERE ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION. REGION 6021 (S14E06) SUPPLIED THE ONLY OTHER M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M1/1F FLARE AT 18/0342Z. GENERAL DECAY NOTED HERE ALSO. REGION 6022 (N31E02) REMAINED QUIET DESPITE IT'S SIZE AND APPARENT COMPLEXITY. REGION 6031 (S18E34) HAS GROWN RAPIDLY WHILE PRODUCING NUMEROUS FLARES. THE LARGEST OF WHICH, A C5/SF FLARE AT 18/0212Z. THE REMAINING REGIONS WERE GENERALLY STABLE. REGION 6032 (S12E26) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6018, 6021, OR 6022 WITH 6021 AND 6022 POSSESSING THE BEST POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 6031 MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ELEVATED ACTIVITY LEVELS AS IT MATURES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS WITH BRIEF MINOR STORMING OBSERVED NEAR THE START OF THE PERIOD. FURTHER ANALYSIS OF SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON DATA INDICATES THE LOW-LEVEL ENHANCEMENT OF GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS IS STILL IN PROGRESS WITH FLUXES NEAR OR ABOVE THE 10 PFU THRESHOLD. THIS EVENT BEGAN 17/0500Z WITH A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 12 PFU OBSERVED SO FAR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE FIRST DAY DECLINING TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ONLY SMALL C-CLASS OR LESS FLARES OBSERVED. REGION 6049 (N16E56) IS THE LARGEST SPOT GROUP ON THE DISK. IT IS AN E-TYPE SPOT GROUP WITH A SIMPLE BETA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. THREE NEW SPOT GROUPS NUMBERED TODAY: 6050 (S13E59), 6051 (S08W61) AND 6052 (S14E44). REMAINDER OF DISK AND LIMB IS QUIET AND UNIMPRESSIVE. SOLAR BACKGROUND LEVELS CONTINUE TO FALL. TODAY'S 10CM RADIO FLUX VALUE OF 121 IS THE LOWEST SINCE SEPTEMBER 1988.

sections.text: LOW. NO SIGNIFICANT REGIONS ARE DUE TO RETURN OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CURRENT SPOT GROUPS VISIBLE ON THE DISK SHOW NO REAL POTENTIAL FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. ONLY ONE WEAK CLASS C1 ENHANCEMENT WAS OBSERVED. REGION 6049 (N16E43) GREW SLOWLY AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES AS DID REGION 6050 (S13E47). sections.text: SHOULD BE AT PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE FORECAST PERIOD. INTERVALS OF MINOR STORMING ARE POSSIBLE, ESPECIALLY DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME, ON 07-08 MAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6049 (N18E03) PRODUCED AN M3/SF FLARE AT 08/1855Z. THE FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP WITH AN ESTIMATED SHOCK SPEED OF 800-1000 KM/SEC. THIS REGION'S RATE OF GROWTH STABILIZED, BUT IT REMAINED THE MOST COMPLEX OF THE VISIBLE REGIONS. GROWING REGION 6054 (S17E51) PRODUCED AN M1/1B AT 08/0027Z ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 6052 (S12W10) REMAINED IN A SLOW GROWTH PHASE AND PRODUCED ISOLATED SUBFLARES. INTENSE IRON XIV CORONAL EMISSION WAS REPORTED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR WHERE OLD REGION 6021 IS EXPECTED TO RETURN (EARLY ON 10 MAY). OLD REGION 6021 WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS OF ACTIVITY ON ITS LAST TRANSIT. THREE SMALL NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 6057 (S47W37), 6058 (N13E64), AND 6059 (S08W62).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. MOSTLY C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6049, 6052, AND 6054. REGION 6049 REMAINS THE PRINCIPAL THREAT FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS INCREASING TO ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE FINAL DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS INCREASE IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M1 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 09/0413Z. REGION 6054 (S18E39) PRODUCED A C8/2B PARALLEL-RIBBON FLARE AT 09/1326Z. MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE. REGION 6049 (N18W10) INCREASED ITS SPOT COUNT AND REMAINED THE MOST COMPLEX OF THE VISIBLE GROUPINGS; IT PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. AN ACTIVE PROMINENCE REGION AND INTENSE IRON XIV CORONAL EMISSIONS WERE OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB POSSIBLY HERALDING THE RETURN OF OLD ACTIVE REGION 6021. NEW REGION 6060 (N22E74), AN H-TYPE GROUP, WAS ASSIGNED.

THE STORMING MAY HAVE BEEN IN RESPONSE TO A LARGE FILAMENT WHICH DEPARTED THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT BETWEEN 04/2100-05/0300Z.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN X3 X-RAY BURST WAS OBSERVED AT 10/1930Z FROM BEHIND THE EAST LIMB AT LATITUDE N28. A TYPE II SWEEP (EST. SHOCK VEL. 1600 KM/SEC), A 1200 SFU TENFLARE, AND A VERY BRIGHT LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM ACCOMPANIED THE BURST. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M3 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 10/1539Z ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 6054 (S18E24) SHOWED SLIGHT GROWTH AND PRODUCED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C2 AT 09/2305Z. REGION 6049 (N18W23) APPEARED TO RELAX IN MAGNETIC ASPECTS AND WAS FAIRLY STABLE. NEW REGION 6061 (N15E16) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. HIGH ACTIVITY MAY COME FROM THE NORTHEAST LIMB AS THE YET UNSEEN SUNSPOT GROUP ROTATES INTO VIEW. M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR FROM REGIONS 6049 AND 6054.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 53 NANOTESLA WAS OBSERVED AT BOULDER AT 09/2128Z. THE STORMING OCCURRED FROM 10/0600-1200Z AND MAY HAVE BEEN IN RESPONSE TO A LARGE FILAMENT WHICH DEPARTED THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT BETWEEN 04/2100-05/0300Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DUE TO LINGERING FILAMENT EFFECTS COUPLED WITH ANTICIPATED CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN X2 X-RAY EVENT WAS OBSERVED AT 11/0548Z FROM BEHIND THE EAST LIMB NEAR LATITUDE N34. TWO REGIONS ARE ROTATING ONTO THE DISK NEAR THAT LOCATION: 6062 (N30E67) AND 6063 (N34E79) BOTH ASSIGNED TODAY. REGION 6063 APPEARS TO BE THE LIKELY SOURCE FOR THIS ACTIVITY SO FAR WHICH ALSO INCLUDES AN M2 X-RAY EVENT AT 10/2357Z. THIS REGION IS EMERGING NEAR THE LATITUDE WHERE A PREVIOUS, HIGHLY ACTIVE REGION (6022) WAS DUE TO RETURN. REGION 6049 (N18W35) PRODUCED A C8/SB FLARE AT 11/1824Z. GRADUAL DECAY IN OVERALL COVERAGE WAS NOTED. REGION 6054 (S18E11) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH WHILE CONTRIBUTING A C5/1B FLARE AT 11/1505Z. THE REMAINING REGIONS WERE CHARACTERIZED BY GENERALLY STABLE CONDITIONS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. HIGH LEVELS OF ACTIVITY ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6063. REGIONS 6049 AND 6054 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. MAJOR STORMING WAS OBSERVED BRIEFLY BETWEEN 11/0300-0600Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE COUPLED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ENHANCEMENT FROM THE PREVIOUS MAJOR FLARING.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6063 (N34E53) HAS ROTATED COMPLETELY INTO VIEW NOW SHOWING A LARGE SPOT AREA. THE EXTENT OF THE REGIONS MAGNETIC STRUCTURE IS STILL SOMEWHAT VAGUE, DUE TO IT'S LOCATION NEAR THE LIMB, HOWEVER PAST FLARE HISTORY SUGGESTS MODEST COMPLEXITY. A C5/SN FLARE AT 13/1706Z WAS IT'S ONLY SIGNIFICANT EVENT THIS PERIOD. REGION 6064 (S15E66) A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING AREA, PRODUCED THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M2/1N FLARE AT 13/1246Z. NUMEROUS SUBFLARES HAVE ALSO BEEN ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION. REGION 6049 (N18W61) CONTINUED IT'S GRADUAL, QUIET DECAY. AN UNCORRELATED M1 X-RAY EVENT WAS OBSERVED AT 13/0333Z. NEW REGION 6066 (S17E30) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6063 REMAINS THE PREDOMINANT CHOICE FOR MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. REGIONS 6049 AND 6064 MAY ADD TO M-CLASS ACTIVITY LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6063 (N34E43) REMAINS THE LARGEST AND MOST MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AREA ON THE DISK. NUMEROUS C-CLASS SUBFLARES WERE ATTRIBUTED TO THE REGION THIS PERIOD ALONG WITH AN M1/1N FLARE AT 14/1455Z. REGION 6064 (S15E64) CONTINUED TO MATURE. SPOT AREA OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS HAS NEARLY DOUBLED. INCREASED MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY WAS NOTED AS WELL. A C4/1N FLARE AT 14/1646Z WAS THE LARGEST EVENT NOTED FROM THIS REGION TODAY. REGION 6060 (N23E13) SHOWED MINOR GROWTH WHILE PRODUCING OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. REGION 6058 (N13W16) ALSO SHOWED GROWTH IN SPOT AND PLAGE AREA. AN IMPRESSIVE ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED AT 14/1914Z ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR THE LATITUDE OF S42.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE. REGIONS 6063 AND 6064 PROVIDE THE BEST CHANCES FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY WITH 6063 ALSO SHOWING FAVORABLE CHARACTERISTICS FOR MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. REGIONS 6060, 6058, AND 6054 (S17W30) MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY LEVELS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED BRIEFLY AT THE START OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6063 (N33E28) PRODUCED AN X1/3B TENFLARE AT 15/1321Z. ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT WERE MAJOR TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEPS, A 710 SFU TENFLARE, AND AN IMPRESSIVE LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW IN SPOT AREA AND REMAINS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. NUMEROUS SUBFLARES WERE ALSO NOTED FROM THIS REGION. REGION 6064 (S17E40) HAS SHOWN SIGNIFICANT GROWTH THIS PERIOD. SEVERAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA AS WELL AS AN M1/2B FLARE AT 15/0035Z. REGION 6058 (N15W29) PRODUCED A 1N FLARE AT 15/1400Z WHICH RESULTED IN THE ERUPTION OF A 14-DEGREE-LONG SEGMENT OF FILAMENT. REGION 6060 (N22E01) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH IN BOTH SPOT AND PLAGE AREA AND SHOWS SIGNS OF CONTINUED DEVELOPEMENT. REGION 6067 (S16E13) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6063 POSES THE GREATEST THREAT FOR CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION WITH REGION 6064 SHOWING THE POTENTIAL FOR OCCASIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS. REGIONS 6058 AND 6060 MAY CONTRIBUTE ISOLATED ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE STARTING ON 17 MAY AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S X1/3B FLARE. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10MEV MAY ALSO BECOME ENHANCED STARTING 16 MAY AS A RESULT OF THIS MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6063 (N33E16) SHOWED SOME DECAY IN SPOT NUMBER AND AREA BUT REMAINS VERY COMPLEX WITH IT'S REVERSED POLARITY DELTA SPOT CONFIGURATION. IT PRODUCED THE ONLY M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M1/1B FLARE AT 16/0109Z. OCCASIONAL SUBFLARING WAS ALSO NOTED. REGION 6064 (S16E27) DISPLAYED RAPID GROWTH IN THE LAST 24 HOURS, EXCEEDING REGION 6063 IN SPOT NUMBER AND AREA. THE REGION DOES NOT HAVE A STRONGLY COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE AT THIS TIME HOWEVER, WITH ITS EXPANDING PLAGE FIELD AND RAPID SPOT GROWTH, IT SHOWS PROMISE AS A MAJOR FLARE PRODUCER. OCCASIONAL LOW-LEVEL C-CLASS ACTIVITY AND SUBFLARING CHARACTERIZED REGIONS 6060 (N23W13) AND 6054 (S16W53). NEW REGION 6068 (N09E65) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6063 (N35W42) PRODUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT: AN M4/1B AT 0132Z WHICH WAS AC- COMPANIED BY A TYPE II AND A TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP. THE REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL FLARES DURING THE PERIOD INCLUDING AN M1/2N AT 0008Z. THE GROUP APPEARS TO BE FRAGMENTING SLIGHTLY BUT CONTINUES TO POSSESS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS IN A COMPLICATED DELTA STRUCTURE. REGION 6064 (S16W38), THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK (1510 MILLIONTHS), PRODUCED NUMEROUS UPPER LEVEL C-FLARES DURING THE DAY AS WELL AS AN M1/1N AT 0513Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE RELATIVELY CALM, ALTHOUGH REGIONS 6070 (S19E28) AND 6071 (S12E37) SHOWED SIGNS OF GROWTH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6063 (N35W56) PRO- DUCED AN X5/2B FLARE AT 2219Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH LOOPS, STRONG DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS, AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP. THE REGION HAS BEEN REMARKABLY QUIET SINCE THEN, PRODUCING ONLY OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES, AND APPEARS TO BE GRADUALLY DECAYING AND SIMPLIFYING, ALTHOUGH IT RETAINS A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6064 (S15W52) PRODUCED THE ONLY OTHER M-CLASS OR GREATER FLARE: AN M3/1F AT 0057Z. THIS GROUP IS ALSO FRAGMENTING AND SIMPLIFYING. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS RELATIVELY QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6063 AND 6064 ARE THE PRINCIPAL FLARE THREATS. A GRADUAL DOWNWARD TREND IS EXPECTED AS THE REGIONS CONTINUE TO DECLINE. BACKGROUND LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO DROP MARKEDLY ON THE THIRD DAY AS THESE TWO REGIONS DEPART THE VIS- IBLE DISK.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WITH A PERIOD OF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FROM 06-09Z. THE DAY BEGAN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS. STORMING BEGAN AROUND 06Z AND LASTED FOR MOST OF THE REST OF THE DAY. THE SOURCE OF THE DISTURBANCE IS UNCERTAIN BUT MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH DISAPPEAR- ING FILAMENT ACTIVITY WHICH OCCURRED OVER THE LAST FEW DAYS. A PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 2355Z IN RESPONSE TO THE X5 FLARE AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS. THE PEAK FLUX WAS 410 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT 0750Z. THE EVENT HAD A HARD SPECTRUM AS HIGH ENERGY PARTICLES WERE ENHANCED BY THREE ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE (19 PFU AT GREATER THAN 100 MEV AT 0500Z) AND RESULTED IN A BRIEF GROUND LEVEL EVENT. A PCA EVENT BEGAN AT 0445Z, PEAKED AT 5.5 DB AT 0745Z AND ENDED AT 2000Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH ABOUT MIDDAY TOMORROW. EFFECTS FROM THE M4 FLARE OF 21 MAY ARE EXPECTED TO CAUSE SOME ACTIVITY ON THE SECOND DAY. EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S X5 FLARE ARE EXPECTED TO START LATE ON THE SECOND DAY AND LAST THROUGH THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO THE X5 OF 21 MAY. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED X1 FLARE OCCURRED AT 26/2058Z.  THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A DISCRETE RADIO BURST OF 1200 SFU AT 2695 MHZ AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP.  ALTHOUGH THERE WAS NO OPTICAL FLARE OBSERVED, THE SOURCE IS MOST LIKELY REGION 6063 (NW34), NOW A DAY BEHIND THE WEST LIMB.  REGION 6077 (N20E55) CONTINUED TO GENERATE FLARES, THE LARGEST BEING AN M2/1B AT 26/1800Z.  THIS REGION HAS GROWN SOMEWHAT OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS AND APPEARS TO POSSESS MODERATE MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THE REMAINING DISK REGIONS WERE RELATIVELY QUIET.  NEW REGION 6079 (S25E75) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 6077 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF M CLASS ACTIVITY.  REGION 6063 IS EXPECTED TO ROTATE OUT OF OUR RANGE OF INFLUENCE BEFORE IT CAN GENERATE FURTHER MAJOR ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT MIDDLE LATITUDE STATIONS (41 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER) AT 26/2025Z.  THIS IS THOUGHT TO BE THE RESULT OF THE X9/1B FLARE OF 24 MAY.  THE PROTON EVENT CONTINUES IN PROGRESS.  THE PROTON FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV SURPASSED THE 10 PFU EVENT THRESHOLD AT 24/2125Z AND REACHED A PRELIMINARY PEAK FLUX OF 180 PFU AT 25/0115Z.  SO FAR, THE PEAK FLUX AT GREATER THAN 50 MEV AND 100 MEV WAS 41 PFU AT 24/2200Z AND 19 PFU AT 24/2155Z, RESPECTIVELY.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARING CHARACTERIZED THE PERIOD. REGION 6093 (S19, L136) DEPARTED THE DISK EARLY IN THE PERIOD AFTER DISPLAYING AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AT 08/0226Z. REGION 6089 (N09E08) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES TO INCLUDE A C5/SF FLARE AT 08/1537Z. CONTINUED GROWTH IN SPOT AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY WERE NOTED. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6100 (S13E73) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY WITH A LARGE UNIPOLAR SPOT AREA VISIBLE SO FAR. THIS AREA IS RETURNING OLD REGION 6064 WHICH PRODUCED NUMEROUS M-CLASS EVENTS DURING ITS LAST TRANSIT. REGIONS 6097 (S09E17), 6098 (S12E54), AND 6099 (S19E59) WERE ALSO ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. OCCASIONAL SUBFLARING IS EXPECTED FROM REGION 6089. THIS AREA ALSO SHOWS THE POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY. REGION 6100 WAS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE UNCORRELATED M4 X-RAY EVENT NOTED 07/1930Z AND MAY CONTRIBUTE SIGNIFICANTLY TO ACTIVITY LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF MINOR STORMING NOTED AT HIGH LATITUDES BETWEEN 08/0900-1200Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. SEVERAL UNCORRELATED LOW-LEVEL C-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS STARTED OUT THE PERIOD. REGION 6089 (N09W05) CONTINUED TO MATURE. AN INCREASINGLY COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE LEAD TO THE OCCURENCE OF AN M2/2B TENFLARE OBSERVED AT 09/1651Z. A MAJOR TYPE IV SWEEP AND MODEST RADIO BURST EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT. OCCASIONAL SUBFLARING THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD WAS ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION. REGION 6100 (S13E62) CONTINUES TO ROTATE INTO VIEW DISPLAYING A LARGE LEADING SPOT SO FAR. THE APPEARANCE OF AN ARCH FILAMENT SYSTEM TRAILING THIS SPOT COUPLED WITH AN EXTENSIVE PLAGE FIELD SUGGEST A MODESTLY COMPLEX SPOT GROUP FOLLOWS. AN M1/1N FLARE WAS OBSERVED IN THIS REGION AT 09/1426Z. A C4/1F FLARE ACCOMPANIED BY BRIGHT SURGING WAS NOTED ON THE LIMB NEAR N34 AT 09/2015Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS ACTIVITY AND ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6089 AND 6100. THE REMAINING REGIONS MAY CONTRIBUTE ISOLATED SUBFLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES WITH MAJOR STORMING OBSERVED BRIEFLY AT HIGH LATITUDES. SEVERAL RECENT DISAPPEARING SOLAR FILAMENTS AND A NORTHERN HEMISPHERE CORONAL HOLE ARE POSSIBLE SOURCES FOR THIS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS THE NEXT TWO DAYS RETURNING TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6089 (N09W19) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD.  THE FIRST, AN M2/2B TENFLARE AT 10/0721Z HAD AN ASSOCIATED TYPE IV SWEEP AND MODEST RADIO EMISSIONS.  THE SECOND WAS AN M3/1B WHICH OCCURRED AT 10/1506Z AND HAD A TYPE II SWEEP ASSOCIATED WITH IT. ADDITIONAL FLARING WAS OBSERVED FROM REGION 6100 (S14E50) AND REGION 6095 (N23W12) WHICH SHOWED CONSIDERABLE GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD.  RECENTLY INACTIVE REGION 6090 (S23W65) REEMERGED AS A SIMPLE SPOT GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  C-CLASS ACTIVITY AND ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6089, 6095, AND 6100.  THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF REGIONS 6089 AND 6095 MAKE INTERACTION AND RESULTING MAJOR FLARING A POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE PAST 24 HOURS.  SEVERAL PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES.  THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLY THE CORONAL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT AND THE RECENT DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  THREE M-CLASS FLARES HIGHLIGHTED THE DAYS ACTIVITY.  EARLY IN THE PERIOD REGION 6089 (N10W32) PRODUCED AN M1/SF WHICH REACHED A MAXIMUM AT 10/2205Z AND HAD A TYPE IV SWEEP ASSOCIATED.  AT 11/0945Z REGION 6089 PRODUCED AN M4/2B.  THE THIRD M-CLASS FLARE ORIGINATED IN REGION 6100 (S15E37), AN M1/2N AT 11/1855Z. ADDITIONAL SUBFLARING WAS OBSERVED FROM REGION 6095 (N24W26) AND THIS REGION HAS SHOWN CONTINUED GROWTH IN SIZE AND SPOT COUNT, ALTHOUGH MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY HAS REMAINED STABLE. THESE THREE REGIONS, 6089, 6095, AND 6100, REMAIN THE LARGEST AND MOST ACTIVE ON THE DISK.  THE REMAINDER OF THE SPOTTED REGIONS WERE SMALL AND MOSTLY STABLE.  REGION 6103 (N16E45) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  REGIONS 6089, 6095, AND 6100 CONTINUE TO HAVE CONSIDERABLE POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6089 (N09W46) PRODUCED AN M6/2B TENFLARE AT 0541Z. THE 2695 MHZ BURST REACHED 750 SFU AND A TYPE IV SWEEP WAS ASSOCIATED. AT 0051Z AN M1/0B WITH TYPES II AND IV WAS ATTRIBUTED TO REGION 6096 (N26E14), A SIMPLE BXO TYPE GROUP. THIS REGION HAS SHOWN ONLY SLIGHT GROWTH TODAY. ADDITIONAL SUBFLARING WAS NOTED FROM REGIONS 6100 (S14E47) AND 6095 (N22W38). TWO NEW REGIONS, 6105 (N13E59) AND 6106 (S30E56) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6089 RETAINED ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AFTER THE FLARE ALTHOUGH IT DIMINISHED SLIGHTLY IN SIZE. REGION 6095 HAS CONTINUED ITS GROWTH AND ALONG WITH REGION 6089 MAINTAINS THE ABILITY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN COMMENCEMENT OF 52 NANOTESLA OCCURRED AT 0820Z AS MEASURED AT BOULDER. THIS IS PROBABLY AN EFFECT OF THE M3/1B FLARE AT 10/1506Z FROM REGION 6089, THEN AT N08W13. THE GOES-6 AND 7 SATELIITES BOTH CROSSED THE MAGNETOPAUSE, THE FIRST OCCURRENCE BEING ABOUT 1700Z. A MODEST GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 1140Z, AND HAS REACHED A TENTATIVE MAXIMUM OF 79 PFU AT 1700Z. THIS EVENT IS THOUGHT TO BE THE RESULT OF THE M6/2B FLARE FROM REGION 6089. ALSO A SMALL PCA BEGAN AT 1545Z AND CONTINUES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THERE IS A DISTINCT CHANCE OF BRIEF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SIX OF THE EIGHT SPOTTED REGIONS PRODUCED LOW-LEVEL FLARES, BUT NONE EXCEEDED THE C-5 LEVEL. MOST GROUPS WERE STABLE WITH THE EXCEPTION BEING REGION 6106 (S31E31) WHICH GREW SUBSTANTIALLY IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA. A 10 DEGREE-LONG FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM N40W37 VERY EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITHOUT ANY ACCOMPANYING X-RAY ENHANCEMENT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY COME FROM REGIONS 6089 (N12W72), 6095 (N24W64), 6100 (S14W00), AND 6106.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE MEASURING 109 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER OCCURRED AT 0310Z. RECENT FLARE AND FILAMENT ACTIVITY MAKES IDENTIFICATION OF THE SOLAR ORIGIN DIFFICULT, BUT THE TIMING OF THE SHOCK SUGGESTS IT MAY HAVE BEEN LAUNCHED BY ONE OF THE M-CLASS FLARES EARLY ON 12 JUNE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS FOR THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS. THE WEAKENING OF THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD RESULT IN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS IN FORCE BY 17 JUNE.

sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THE PERIOD BEGAN WITH AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M1 X-RAY BURST AT 27/2113Z8. NEW REGION 6133 (N18E76), THUS FAR REPORTED AS A LARGE ASSYMETRICAL H-TYPE SPOT WHICH CONTINUED TO ROTATE INTO VIEW, PRODUCED THE REMAINING TWO M-CLASS EVENTS OF THE DAY: AN M2/SF FLARE AT 28/1409Z AND AN M2/1N AT FLARE 28/2034Z. REGION 6122 (S21E06) DECLINED SLOWLY IN MAGNETIC ASPECTS AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES INCLUDING A C5/1N AT 28/0108Z. REGION 6125 (N05E13) GREW FROM A PLAGE REGION INTO AN INCREASINGLY COMPLEX D-TYPE SPOT GROUP. REGION 6127 (N08E47) ALSO DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH AND PRODUCED A 1F FLARE AT 28/0407Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM, BUT NO X-RAY BURST. REGIONS 6134 (N13E30) AND 6135 (S19E34) WERE ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6122 AND 6133 DISPLAY POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION. REGIONS 6125 AND 6127 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE C-CLASS SUBFLARES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6126 (S13W29) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE THE MAJORITY OF FLARE ACTIVITY WITH A C5/SF FLARE AT 03/0604Z NOTED AS THE LARGEST OF THE PERIOD. THIS REGION APPEARS TO HAVE REACHED MATURITY NOW WITH A SLIGHTLY COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE STILL INTACT. REGION 6133 (N17E18) CONTINUES TO APPEAR THREATENING WITH ITS LARGE SPOT AREA AND COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. HOWEVER A SINGLE C4/SN FLARE, NOTED AT 03/0956Z, HAS BEEN THE ONLY X-RAY EVENT OBSERVED FROM THIS AREA SINCE 30 JUNE. REGION 6131 (S21W11) DISPLAYED MODEST GROWTH IN SPOT AREA AND SHOWS POTENTIAL FOR INCREASED COMPLEXITY. THE REMAINING REGIONS REMAINED GENERALLY STABLE. THREE UNCORRELATED C-CLASS EVENTS WERE OBSERVED, POSSIBLY HAILING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6100 (S14, L313) DUE TO ROTATE BACK ONTO THE DISK ON 5 JULY. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. PREDOMINANTLY C-CLASS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED WITH REGIONS 6126, 6131, AND 6133 POSING THE GREATEST THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS NOTED BETWEEN 0300-0600Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED WITH ACTIVE CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT THE END OF THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE PERIOD WAS A PAIR OF M-CLASS EVENTS ERUPTING IN TANDEM IN OPPOSITE HEMISPHERES OF THE DISK. REGION 6138 (N23E23) STARTED OFF THE PROCESSION AT 04/1654Z WITH AN M7/2B FLARE ACCOMPANIED BY DARK SURGING AND A 670 SOLAR FLUX UNIT TENFLARE. THIS REGION DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN SPOT AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN THE PAST 24 HOURS, ESPECIALLY IN THE LEADING PORTION OF THE REGION WHERE THE MAJOR FLARE LATER ERUPTED. REGION 6131 (S21W26) PRODUCED THE SECOND M EVENT: AN M4/2B FLARE AT 04/1743Z. REGIONS 6126 (S11W41) AND 6133 (N18E04) REMAINED GENERALLY STABLE DESPITE THEIR APPARENT COMPLEXITY.

sections.text: MODERATE WITH REGIONS 6126, 6131, 6133, AND 6138 SHOWING PROMISE FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION.

A DISAPPEARING FILAMENT OCCURRED OVERNIGHT. THE FILAMENT WAS APPROXIMATELY 45 DEGREES AND WAS LAST OBSERVED BY BOULDER ON 24 JUNE AT 1523Z.THE FILAMENT'S LAST LOCATION WAS CENTERED AT N65E10. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6174 (S12E38), A SIMPLE UNIPOLAR SPOT AREA, PRODUCED AN M2/2N TENFLARE WITH ASSOCIATED MINOR TYPE IV SWEEP AT 26/2335Z. THIS WAS A LONG DURATION EVENT AND IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE PROTON EVENT NOTED BELOW. REGION 6162 (N10W27) PRODUCED THE SECOND M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M3/1B FLARE AT 26/1704Z. THE FLARE ERUPTED IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THIS REGION WHERE A WEAK DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION EXISTS. THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WAS CHARACTERIZED BY LOW-LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS AND SUBFLARING. NEW REGION 6179 (N16E68) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE NOTED NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD WITH THE OCCURRENCE OF A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 19 NANOTESLAS AT 26/2056Z. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS BECAME ENHANCED AT 26/0030Z IN RESPONSE TO THE M2/2N FLARE FROM REGION 6174 NOTED ABOVE. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS REACHED EVENT LEVEL AT 26/1720Z WITH A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 13 PFU NOTED AT 26/1735Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE PROTON EVENT NOTED IN PARAGRAPH IIA. ABOVE SHOULD CONTINUE IN PROGRESS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS SLOWLY RETURNING TO BACKGROUND LEVELS THEREAFTER.

sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE PERIOD WAS A C6/1N FLARE AT 27/0006Z FROM REGION 6162 (N10W39). A C2/SF FLARE AT 26/2337Z WAS ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION WHICH IS NOW SHOWING A STEADY DECLINE IN SPOT AREA WITH SOME LOSS OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6176 (S18W82) PRODUCED THE ONLY OTHER X-RAY EVENT OF THE PERIOD: A C1/SF FLARE AT 27/1521Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY BRIGHT SURGING. REGIONS 6172 (S25E24), 6174 (S13E26), AND 6177 (S21E32) HAVE FORMED INTO A TRIAD OF STACKED AND ABUTTED SPOT GROUPS WHICH HAVE SHOWN SOME GROWTH IN SPOT AREA AND COMPLEXITY. NEW REGION 6180 (N17E64) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6162 CONTINUES TO POSE A REASONABLE THREAT FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS WITH THE CLUSTER OF REGIONS IN THE SOUTHEAST (6174, 6177, AND 6172) PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL SOURCE FOR ENHANCED C-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS STARTED OUT THE PERIOD WITH THE FIELD DECAYING TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS THEREAFTER. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT THAT BEGAN 26/1720Z REACHED A PEAK OF 19 PFU AT 27/0500Z AND SETTLED BELOW THE 10 PFU THRESHOLD AT 27/1520Z WITH THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS STILL ENHANCED ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6162 (N10W51) CONTINUED TO DECAY IN SPOT AREA AND COMPLEXITY. A C2/SF FLARE AT 28/0245Z WAS THE ONLY SIGNIFICANT EVENT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS REGION TODAY. REGION 6171 (N10W01) PRODUCED A C1/SF FLARE AT 28/1002Z. ISOLATED SUBFLARING CHARACTERIZED THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY'S ACTIVITY. NEW REGIONS 6181 (S09E42) AND 6182 (N13W35) WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ONLY ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED WITH REGIONS 6162, 6177 (S20E19), AND 6174 (S12E13) POSING THE GREATEST THREAT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. MINOR STORM LEVELS COMMENCED AT 28/0112Z WHEN AN IMPULSE MEASURING 41 NANOTESLAS WAS OBSERVED. A SECOND IMPULSE WAS NOTED AT 28/0334Z (68 NANOTESLAS). THE LIKELY SOURCE FOR THIS ACTIVITY WAS THE LONG DURATION M2/2N FLARE NOTED LATE 25 JULY. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT THAT BEGAN 26/1720Z AND PEAKED AT 26/2315Z (21 PFU), CONTINUES IN PROGRESS WITH THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV LEVEL PROTONS STILL FLUCTUATING NEAR THE 10 PFU THRESHOLD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS AT THE BEGINING OF THE PERIOD WITH THE FIELD SETTLING TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS SHOULD BEGIN TO RETURN TO BACKGROUND LEVELS WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. ONLY ISOLATED SUBFLARING WAS OBSERVED. REGION 6174 (S12W00) PRODUCED THE MOST ENERGETIC SUBFLARE OF THE PERIOD AT 28/2125Z. sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE THE FIRST DAY OF THE PERIOD WITH THE TREND TOWARDS LOW LEVELS OF ACTIVITY THEREAFTER. INTERACTION BETWEEN REGIONS 6172 (S23W03), 6177 (S19E07), AND 6174 MAY PRODUCE OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARING OR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS OBSERVED PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING. FURTHER ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT A 27 DEGREE SEGMENT OF FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED 25 JULY MAY HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THIS ACTIVITY ALONG WITH THE LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT NOTED THE SAME DAY. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT (GREATER THAN 10 MEV) ENDED 28/1310Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS THE FIRST DAY OF THE PERIOD WITH ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS EXPECTED THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6180 (N18E30) A MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE CAO GROUP, PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M4/2B TENFLARE AT 0736Z.  TYPES II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS WERE ALSO DETECTED AND THE ASSOCIATED SHOCK SPEED WAS ESTIMATED AT 1000 KM/SEC.  A NUMBER OF ERUPTIVE PROMINENCES WERE OBSERVED ON THE SE LIMB TODAY, FROM ABOUT 20S - 80S, THE LARGEST EXTENDED OUT TO APPROXIMATELY .26 SOLAR RADII.  NEW REGION 6184 (S08E34) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 6180 HAS NOT CHANGED SIGNIFICANTLY SINCE ITS EARLIER LDE AND MAY STILL POSSESS SOME POTENTIAL FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE.  OTHER POTENTIAL FOR ACTIVITY COMES FROM REGION 6162 (N12W78) AND THE GROUP OF THREE REGIONS 6172 (S23W16), 6174 (S11W13, AND 6177 (S19W05) WHOSE INTERACTION MAY BE SUFFICIENT FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS RANGED FROM QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.   ONE PERIOD OF MINOR STORMING WAS OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED.  A SLIGHT INCREASE IN ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE BY AUGUST 01 DUE TO TODAY'S LDE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A PERIOD OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS WAS RECORDED EARLY IN THE DAY.  A PROTON ENHANCEMENT BEGAN AROUND 0600Z, PASSED 4PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AROUND 2030Z AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS.  THIS ENHANCEMENT IS MOST LIKELY IN RESPONSE TO THE M4/2B LDE EARLY ON 30 JULY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED.  SOME PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY IN RESPONSE TO THE M4/2B LDE AND A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.  IF THE CURRENT PROTON ENHANCEMENT REACHES EVENT LEVELS, IT IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE THE EVENT THRESHOLD ONLY A SHORT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET TO ACTIVE THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE PERIOD AT QUIET LEVELS, THEN AT 0743Z A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 39 GAMMA WAS OBSERVED AT BOULDER FOLLOWED BY SEVERAL PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS.  YESTERDAY'S PROTON ENHANCEMENT PASSED EVENT LEVELS AT 0005Z, HAS REACHED A TENTATIVE MAXIMUM OF 220 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT 1955Z AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN AT 1330Z AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  ADDITIONAL PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY THROUGH 03 AUGUST DUE TO THE CONTINUED EFFECTS OF THE M4/2B LDE OF 30 JULY AND A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  THE CONTINUED GROWTH AND ACTIVITY EXHIBITED BY REGION 6172 MAKES MORE M-CLASS FLARES FROM IT A POSSIBILITY. REGIONS 6185 (N24E47) AND 6186 (N16E50) ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED.  THE PERIOD BEGAN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS AND BECAME MOSTLY QUIET BY ABOUT 1200Z.  THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 230 PFU AT 01/2015Z, FELL BELOW EVENT THRESHOLDS AT 02/1805Z BUT REMAINS ENHANCED.  THE POLAR CAP ABSORBTION EVENT ENDED AT 1500Z.  A SLIGHT FOREBUSH DECREASE WAS NOTED TODAY AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS. THEN PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE IN RESPONSE TO A CORONAL HOLE.  ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED AGAIN BY LATE ON DAY TWO THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW AND IS DEVELOPING INCREASED MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED INCLUDE 6201 (N15W86), 6202 (S35E55), 6203 (N19E78), AND 6204 (S34E39).

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6203 (N18E68) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS, AN M7/2B AT 10/1820Z.  THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP AND A 2800 MHZ (10.7 CM) RADIO BURST OF 883 SFU.  THIS REGION OBVIOUSLY CONTAINS MODERATE MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, ALTHOUGH THIS IS NOT APPARENT BY ITS H-ALPHA AND WHITE LIGHT APPEARANCE NEAR THE EAST LIMB.  REGION 6197 (N14E39) HAS STABILIZED IN ITS DEVELOPMENT.  IT HAS ONLY PRODUCED A FEW SMALL FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY.  NEW REGION 6205 (S18E07) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH THE CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.  REGIONS 6197 AND 6203 ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE PRIMARY FLARE PRODUCERS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  ONLY A FEW C CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED SINCE YESTERDAY'S M7/2B IN REGION 6203 (N18E57).  THIS REGION IS NOW CLEARLY IN VIEW AND DOES POSSESS SOME COMPLEXITY.  MAGNETICALLY, IT IS REVERSE POLARITY, WITH THE LARGEST SPOT TO THE WEST A FOLLOWER POLARITY SPOT AND THE TWO LARGE SPOTS TO THE EAST LEADER POLARITY SPOTS. FURTHERMORE, ITS APPEARANCE IN H-ALPHA SUGGESTS THAT THIS GROUP MAY MORE ACCURATELY BE VIEWED AS A SMALLER REVERSE POLARITY SUNSPOT GROUP TO THE WEST, ABUTTED AGAINST A SINGLE UNIPOLAR SPOT TO THE EAST.  THIS CONFIGURATION MAY HELP EXPLAIN THE OCCURRANCE OF THE M7/2B FLARE YESTERDAY.  REGION 6197 (N14E25) HAS SIMPLIFIED SOMEWHAT OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS AND HAS ONLY PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED TODAY INCLUDE 6206 (S14E68), 6207 (S06W58), 6208 (N03E54), AND 6209 (N23E83).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  M CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE IN REGIONS 6197 AND 6203.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  TWO M CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED SINCE YESTERDAY, AN M1/1F AT 13/0925Z IN REGION 6199 (N12E11) AND AN M1/1B AT 13/1337Z JUST TO THE WEST NEAR REGION 6197 (N13W01).  REGION 6199 IS DEVELOPING RAPIDLY, INCREASING ITS SUNSPOT AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6197 CONTINUES TO DECAY.  REGION 6203 (N18E31) HAS STARTED TO DECAY AND HAS PRODUCED A FEW SMALL FLARES. REGION 6209 (N22E59) IS GROWING SLOWLY AND HAS ALSO PRODUCED A FEW SMALL FLARES.  REGION 6212 (S27E78) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  THERE IS A CHANCE OF A MAJOR FLARE IN THE 6197/6199 SPOT COMPLEX.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES.  HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS WERE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH A FEW PERIODS OF STORM CONDITIONS AT CERTAIN STATIONS. THE PROTON FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS ENHANCED BUT BELOW THE 10 PFU EVENT THRESHOLD.  THIS ENHANCEMENT IS PROBABLY RELATED TO THE M7 FLARE ON 10 AUGUST IN REGION 6203.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.  INCREASED ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE AS A RESULT OF A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY, A C7/SF AT 17/1703Z, OCCURRED WITHIN REGION 6203 (N18W21), A REVERSED POLARITY GROUP. REGION 6199 (N13W43) BEGAN TO SHOW SIGNS OF GRADUAL DECAY. PENUMBRAL FRAGMENTATION WAS OBSERVED IN ITS TRAILER ALONG WITH SOME SIMPLIFICATION OF ITS MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. SEVERAL SUBFLARES OCCURRED FROM A VARIETY OF SMALL REGIONS. REGIONS 6220 (S17W24), 6221 (S17E18), 6222 (S17E60), AND 6223 (S11E85) WERE NUMBERED. SURGING WAS REPORTED AS 6223, A LARGE, ASYMMETRIC H-TYPE SPOT, ROTATED INTO VIEW.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6199, THOUGH SLOWLY DECAYING, REMAINS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6216 (N07W28) PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 17/2342Z AND A C9/SF FLARE AT 17/2259Z. SIGNIFICANT GROWTH OCCURRED IN THIS REGION DURING THE PERIOD. THE SAME WAS TRUE OF REGION 6214 (S10E06) WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. REGION 6199 (N13W57) CONTINUED TO SLOWLY DECAY, BUT REMAINED MODERATELY COMPLEX IN MAGNETIC ASPECTS. NEW REGION 6226 (S22E72) ROTATED INTO VIEW DISPLAYING ACTIVE SURGING AND SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. SURGING WAS ALSO OBSERVED FROM BEHIND THIS REGION STRONGLY SUGGESTING THAT OLD REGION 6172 WILL BE AN ACTIVE GROUP WHEN IT ROTATES INTO VIEW SOMETIME TOMORROW. A LARGE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED SOMETIME NEAR 18/0000Z. IT WAS 30 DEGREES LONG AND CENTERED NEAR N38E03 WHEN LAST VIEWED AT THE BOULDER OBSERVATORY. REGIONS 6224 (S34W13) AND 6225 (N21E43) WERE ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES MAY OCCUR FROM REGIONS 6199 AND 6226.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE ACTIVE LEVELS OCCURRED EARLY IN PERIOD.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS. THE ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO COMMENCE LATE IN THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE MENTIONED ABOVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGIONS 6214 (S10W08) AND 6216 (N06W42) BOTH DISPLAYED MARKED GROWTH IN SPOT AREA DURING THE PERIOD WITH NUMEROUS SUBFLARES OBSERVED. REGION 6199 (N13W70) CONTINUES TO REMAIN STABLE AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB. REGIONS 6223 (S13E60) AND 6226 (S23E63) HAVE COMPLETED THEIR ENTRY ONTO THE DISK WHILE SURGING CONTINUES TO BE OBSERVED ON THE LIMB TRAILING THESE REGIONS. NUMEROUS SUBFLARES HAVE BEEN OBSERVED FROM THESE AREAS ALONG WITH SEVERAL C-CLASS EVENTS ATTRIBUTED TO REGION 6226. A SMALL SEGMENT OF FILAMENT MATERIAL WAS NOTED TO HAVE DISAPPEARED NEAR THE BEGINING OF THE PERIOD. IT WAS LAST OBSERVED BY THE BOULDER OBSERVATORY CENTERED NEAR N12E07. AN IMPRESSIVE ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST LIMB AT 19/0917Z. NEW REGION 6227 (S28E77) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6199 AND THE INTERACTING REGIONS 6223 AND 6226 POSE A THREAT FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGIONS 6214 (S11W35), 6223 (S13E34), AND 6226 (S22E37) HAVE EACH SHOWN NOTABLE GROWTH THROUGHOUT. REGION 6226 PRODUCED THREE C-CLASS FLARES: A C9/SF EVENT AT 21/0433Z, A C9/1F AT 21/0525Z, AND A C9/SF AT 21/1605Z. THIS REGION WAS ALSO THE MAIN CONTRIBUTER TO A LONG DURATION M1 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT THAT WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. REGION 6214, ALTHOUGH DISPLAYING SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN SPOT AREA, HAS ONLY PRODUCED VERY ISOLATED SUBFLARING. REGION 6223 PRODUCED AN M1/1F TENFLARE AT 21/0932Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED FROM DEPARTING REGION 6199 AT 21/1411Z.  NEW REGIONS 6229 (N11W32) AND 6230 (S27E63) WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6214, 6223, AND 6226 PROVIDE A REASONABLE THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARING.
