sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THREE LARGE, IMPRESSIVE REGIONS CURRENTLY DOMINATE THE ACTIVITY ON THE DISK. REGION 6214 (S11W48) CONTINUED ITS GROWTH IN SPOT AREA AND MAIN- TAINS A LARGE, WELL DEFINED ARCH FILAMENT SYSTEM. THIS REGION HOWEVER REMAINED QUIET THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 6223 (S12E20) APPEARS TO HAVE REACHED MATURITY WITH SOME DECAY NOW EXHIBITED. NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARES WERE ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA. THE LARGEST: A C6/SF FLARE AT 22/1623Z. REGION 6226 (S22E23) DISPLAYED MODEST SPOT AREA GROWTH AND ALSO PRODUCED A C6/SF FLARE AT 22/0759Z. THE 1700Z 10.7 CM SOLAR FLUX CLIMBED TO 313 SFU TODAY. THE LAST TIME THE FLUX MEASUREMENT SURPASSED THE 300 SFU MARK WAS 15 JUNE 1989 WHEN A VALUE OF 324 SFU WAS OBSERVED. UNCORRELATED TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEP FREQUENCY BURSTS WERE OBSERVED AT 22/1958Z AND 22/2003Z RESPECTIVELY. NEW REGIONS 6231 (N12E63) AND 6232 WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE THREAT OF M-CLASS FLARING REMAINS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6214, 6223, AND 6226.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THIS ACTIVITY IS BELIEVED TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH EFFECTS FROM A LARGE FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED 17-18 AUGUST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS THE FIRST DAY WITH THE TREND TOWARDS GENERALLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD, A C8/SF FLARE AT 23/0129Z, ORIGINATED FROM REGION 6216 (N07W90) PRIOR TO ROUNDING THE WEST LIMB. THE THREE DOMINANT REGIONS ON THE DISK, 6214 (S11W61), 6223 (S12E07), AND 6226 (S21E09) EACH HAVE DEVELOPED SUNSPOT AREAS OF OVER 1000 MILLIONTHS DURING THEIR TIME ON THE DISK. THESE REGIONS HOWEVER HAVE ONLY BEEN ABLE TO MUSTER C-CLASS EVENTS FOR THE MOST PART. A C5/SF FLARE WAS CONTRIBUTED BY REGION 6226 AT 22/2210Z. REGION 6223 MANAGED ONLY ISOLATED SUB-FLARING. REGION 6233 (N14E78) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY AND CLOSED OUT THE PERIOD WITH A C7/SN FLARE AT 23/2041Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. AN ISOLATED M-FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM EITHER REGION 6214, 6223, OR 6226.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. MAJOR STORMING WAS OBSERVED BRIEFLY AT MIDDLE LATITUDE STATIONS BETWEEN 23/0300-0900Z. HIGHER LATITUDES HAVE EXPERIENCED MAJOR STORMING FOR THE MAJORITY OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT THE START OF THE PERIOD WITH THE TREND TOWARDS ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6223 (S12W07), PRODUCED THE DAY'S LONE M-CLASS EVENT, AN M1/1N AT 0940Z. THIS GROUP AND NEARBY REGION 6226 (S21W03) DOMINATE THE CENTER OF THE DISK. FREQUENT SURGING HAS BEEN SEEN NEAR REGION 6214 (S12W74), ALSO IMPOSING IN H-ALPHA AND WHITE LIGHT. THE BACK- GROUND X-RAY AND 10 CM. FLUX VALUES REMAIN ELEVATED WITH THE RADIO FLUX BEING THE HIGHEST RECORDED SINCE JUNE, 1989. A FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR N60W15 DISAPPEARED IN THE LAST 24 HOURS. TWO NEW REGIONS, 6234 (N24W03) AND 6235 (S13W19), WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6214, 6223, AND 6226 ALL POSSESS THE ABILITY TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS EARLY IN THE INTERVAL. THE DISTURBANCE HAS SINCE WEAKENED, WITH QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS NOW PREVALENT. THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS THOUGHT TO BE RELATED TO THE FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE OF 17-18 AUGUST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT THREE DAYS. SHORT- LIVED MINOR STORM CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6226 (S22W29) PRODUCED AN M5/2N AT 1624Z THAT INITIATED SMALLER SYMPATHETIC FLARES IN NEARBY REGIONS 6227 (S23W14) AND 6223 (S13W32). MODEST RADIO BURSTS WERE RECORDED ACROSS THE SPECTRUM AS WELL AS A POSSIBLE TYPE II. REGION 6233 (N14E38), WITH A COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE AND BRIGHT PLAGE, YIELDED AN M1/1N AT 1354Z. CURRENTLY REGIONS 6233 AND 6226 ARE THE MOST IMPRESSIVE ON THE DISK AND RETAIN THEIR POTENCY. REGION 6214, NOW BEYOND WEST LIMB NEAR S15, PRODUCED SURGING AS IT DEPARTED. **NOTE: TODAY'S 10.7 CM OTTAWA FLUX MAY BE FLARE ENHANCED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. MAJOR FLARES (M5 OR GREATER) ARE DISTINCTLY POSSIBLE FROM EITHER REGION 6226 OR REGION 6233. ALSO, THE CHANCE OF PROTONS FROM AN ENERGETIC FLARE IS INCREASED AS REGION 6226 ROTATES TO A FAVORABLE POSITION.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6233 (N13E10) PRODUCED A BARRAGE OF ENERGETIC FLARES WITH THE GREATEST AN X3/2B TENFLARE WITH TYPE IV AT 27/2106Z, THE LARGEST X-RAY FLARE IN MORE THAN THREE MONTHS. ITS' RESUME ALSO INCLUDED AN: M4/1B AT 0909Z, M1/0N AT 1022Z, M4/1N AT 1253Z, AND M1/1N AT 1836Z. THE SITE OF MOST OF THE FLARING HAS BEEN IN THE INTER- MEDIATE SPOTS WHERE A DELTA CONFIGURATION AND STRONG MAGNETIC GRADIENTS ARE PRESENT. THIS REGION IS CERTAINLY THE MOST DOMIN- ANT OF THE NINE SPOT GROUPS NOW VISIBLE, ALTHOUGH REGIONS 6226 (S21W55), 6227 (S23W42), AND 6223 (S12W53) YIELDED ISOLATED SMALL FLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. LOOK FOR CONTINUED M-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM 6233, WITH X-CLASS FLARING VERY POSSIBLE. ALSO, REGION 6226 MAY AWAKEN TO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BECOME DISTURBED IN ABOUT 24 HOURS, DUE TO ANTICIPATED FLARE (X3/2B AT 27/2106Z) AND CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL 30 AUGUST AND SUBSEQUENTLY WEAKEN BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6233 (N12W03) CONTINUES TO BE THE DOMINANT REGION ON THE DISK, PRODUCING THREE M-FLARES: M1/1N AT 28/2238Z, M1/SF AT 0819Z & M1/1N AT 2040Z, AS WELL AS NUMEROUS SMALL SUBFLARES. THE REGION CONTINUES TO GROW AND IS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX, SHOWING A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA CONFIG- URATION WITH TWO INVERSION LINE CROSSINGS IN THE LARGE TRAILER SPOT. REGION 6226 (S21W63) PRODUCED MOST OF THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY, WITH AN M1/1F AT 0433Z AND NUMEROUS SMALL SUBFLARES. THIS REGION APPEARS TO BE GRADUALLY DECLINING AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT S12.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY MODERATE. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A FAIR POSSIBILITY FOR HIGH LEVELS, HOWEVER, GIVEN THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF REGION 6223. REGIONS 6223 AND 6226 ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN SOURCES OF ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT 1121Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO THE X3 FLARE OF 27 AUGUST. EFFECTS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE DUE TO A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WILL BE FAVORABLY POSITIONED ON THE SAME DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY SUBSIDE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. MOST OF TODAY'S AC- TIVITY WAS PRODUCED BY REGION 6233 (N13W16),  INCLUDING AN M1/SN AT 0200Z (ALTHOUGH REGION 6223 (S12W83) WAS ALSO FLARING AT THE SAME TIME), AN M1/SF AT 0452Z, AND AN M2/1B AT 1319Z. REGION 6233 CONTINUES TO BE A LARGE, MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX REGION BUT IS NO LONGER GROWING. FOUR NEW REGIONS EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY. ALL OF THEM ARE STRUCTURALLY SIMPLE AND WERE RELATIVELY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY MODERATE. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A FAIR POSSIBILITY FOR HIGH LEVELS, HOWEVER, DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF REGION 6233. REGIONS 6233, 6226 (S21W80), AND 6227 (S24W68) ARE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED EARLY IN THE PERIOD UNTIL ABOUT 0300Z. SINCE THEN CONDITIONS HAVE RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THIS DISTURBANCE COULD BE A RESPONSE TO EITHER THE X3 FLARE OF 27 AUGUST OR A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE WITH SOME BRIEF STORM PERIODS FOR ABOUT 12 MORE HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE GRADUALLY TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. DEPARTING REGION 6226 (S23W93) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1F AT 0415Z. THE DEPARTURE OF 6226 AND OTHER REGIONS IN THE SAME AREA WERE REFLECTED IN THE SIGNFICANT DECREASE OF 10.7 CM FLUX LEVELS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. ONE M-CLASS EVENT WAS OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD: AN M2/SN FROM REGION 6233 (N13W46) AT 0710Z. THE REGION APPEARED TO BE UNDERGOING SOME DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION ALTHOUGH IT CONTINUES TO MAINTAIN A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. NOTABLE GROWTH, BUT NO FLARE ACTIVITY, WAS OBSERVED IN REGIONS 6238 (S13E11) AND 6244 (N13E29). A 22 DEGREE FILAMENT CENTERED AT N11E55 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME BETWEEN 31/2126Z AND 01/1051Z. THE EVENT APPEARED TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH A LONG DURATION C4 X-RAY EVENT THAT WAS OBSERVED FROM 0145Z TO 0403Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN THREAT FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER FLARES IS RE- GION 6233. REGIONS 6238 AND 6244 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE OCCASIONAL SMALL FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL 1240Z WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED. STORM LEVELS FOLLOWED THE IMPULSE FOR ABOUT 6 HOURS, BUT CONDITIONS SUBSIDED SOMEWHAT TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE SOURCE OF THE DISTURBANCE IS UNCERTAIN BUT COULD HAVE BEEN A RESULT OF THE LONG DURATION M1 FLARE THAT OCCURRED EARLY ON 30 AUGUST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR ABOUT HALF- WAY THROUGH THE FIRST DAY, AND SHOULD GRADUALLY DECLINE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE SECOND DAY. GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RESUME EARLY ON THE THIRD DAY AS A RESPONSE TO TODAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE WAS A C3/SF FROM REGION 6233 (N13W59) AT 0146Z. THE GROUP SHOWED CONSIDERABLE DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION AS THE MAIN MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX SPOT IS BREAKING APART. THE GROUP IS STILL JUST BARELY MAINTAINING A DELTA CONFIGURATION. A 15 DEGREE PORTION OF FIL- AMENT MATERIAL  NEAR N10E40  DISAPPEARED SOMETIME  BETWEEN 01/1331Z AND 02/1309Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT S19 FROM 1442Z TO 1503Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS WERE ESSENTIALLY STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6233 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE SOMETIME DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD. REGIONS 6238 (S13W02), 6246 (S15E47), AND 6244 (N12E17) MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE SOME SMALL FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET. YESTERDAY'S DISTURBED LEVELS DID NOT PERSIST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW, BECOMING UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON THE SECOND DAY AND RETURNING TO UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THE FILA- MENT WHICH DISAPPEARED ON 01 SEPTEMBER.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6233 (N13W97) PRODUCED AN M2/SF FLARE AT 0431Z AS IT PASSED OVER THE WEST LIMB.  OTHER ACTIVITY INCLUDED AN UNCORRELATED C8 FLARE AT 0035Z, TWO OTHER LOW LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES AND SEVERAL SUBFLARES FROM REGION 6238 (S12W44).

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW.  ALTHOUGH NO LONGER ON THE DISK, THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF REGION 6233 TO THE LIMB MAKES EFFECTS OF A LARGE FLARE FROM IT A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. HIGHLIGHTS OF THE PERIOD INCLUDE AN M1/1F FLARE AT 14/0417Z FROM REGION 6266 (S28E31) WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP. A LONG DURATION M3 X-RAY EVENT WAS NOTED AT 14/1406Z ORIGINATING FROM AN AREA JUST AROUND THE SOUTHEAST (S20) LIMB. ONLY SUBFLARING WAS VISIBLE AT THIS LOCATION HOWEVER A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM AND EVENT LEVEL BRIGHT SURGING WAS EVIDENT. A SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP WAS ALSO NOTED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THIS EVENT WHICH APPEARS TO BE SIGNALING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6226 (S22). AN M1/2N FLARE AT 14/2015Z FROM REGION 6263 (N10E25) CLOSED OUT THE PERIOD. A SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT. NO MAJOR GROWTH IN SPOT AREA WAS NOTED TODAY. NEW REGIONS 6272 (S12E72), 6273 (N05W26), AND 6274 (S09W07) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE. NEW REGIONS EMERGING ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB ARE EXPECTED TO PROVIDE AN INCREASING THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARING.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. A C2/SF FLARE WAS NOTED AT 15/0558Z FROM REGION (S12E58) WHICH HAS ROTATED COMPLETELY INTO VIEW NOW. REGION 6257 (S11W09) PRODUCED A C6/1N FLARE AT 15/0754Z. REGION 6263 (N10E12) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH. A C2/SF FLARE WITH STRONG RADIO EMISSIONS AT 245MHZ WAS OBSERVED HERE AT 15/0430Z. FREQUENT SURGING CONTINUES ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AS A LARGE PLAGE FIELD ROTATES INTO VIEW. NEW REGION 6275 (S24E67) IS A SMALL SPOT AREA THAT HAS JUST EMERGED IN THIS AREA AND IS A LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE C7/SF FLARE THAT OCCURRED THERE AT 15/0813Z.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6272 (S12E33) HAS SHOWN MODEST GROWTH IN SPOT AREA TODAY AND APPEARS SLIGHTLY MORE COMPLEX. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6272 (S13E22) PRODUCED AN IMPULSIVE M5/1B FLARE AT 17/2156Z. MODERATE TO LARGE DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURSTS ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE WITH A 540 F.U. BURST OBSERVED AT 10CM.  A VIDEO SEQUENCE OF THE EVENT INDICATED A BLAST WAVE PROPAGATED AWAY FROM THE FLARE SITE.  OVERALL, THIS REGION IS IN SLOW DECAY WITH BASICALLY A BIPOLAR STRUCTURE. NUMEROUS SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED FROM MANY OTHER REGIONS.  ACTIVE SURGING WAS VISIBLE NEAR N13E90 - IN A LOCATION WHERE PREVIOUSLY ACTIVE REGION 6233 IS DUE TO RETURN.  AN H SPOT APPEARED AT S24E68 AND WAS NUMBERED AS REGION 6278.  A SMALL GROWING CLASS D GROUP EMERGED AT S08E47 AND BECAME REGION 6279.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BECOME
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE.  REGION 6272 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ANOTHER LOW TO MID M-CLASS FLARE DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD. THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6233 TO THE NORTHEAST LIMB MAY INCREASE THE FREQUENCY OF CLASS M FLARES.  HOWEVER, THE LACK OF ENERGETIC LIMB ACTIVITY AND THE RELATIVE STABILITY OF FULL DISK INDICES ARGUE FOR A LESSER REGION AT THIS LOCATION THIS ROTATION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE PERIOD AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS.  ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN NEAR 18/0800Z AND CONTINUED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  THE EFFECTS FROM THE M5 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON 19 SEP.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S MOST INTERESTING EVENT WAS A LONG DURATION C7 X-RAY FLARE WHICH STARTED AT 1218Z AND LASTED ALMOST TWO HOURS. THE EVENT WAS OPTICALLY CORRELATED WITH FLARING OUT OF REGION 6272 (S13W85), WITH FLARE LOOPS AND WITH AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE ON WEST LIMB AT S18. REGION 6279 (S08W61) SHOWED GROWTH TODAY AND PRODUCED A FEW C-CLASS SUB- FLARES. REGIONS 6280 (N12W10) AND 6283 (N07E24) ALSO CONTRIBUTED A COUPLE SUBFLARES. REGION 6280 MAY BE STARTING TO DECAY AS THE PENUMBRA OF THE LARGE LEADER SPOT IS BEGINNING TO ELONGATE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW, BUT WITH A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM 6280 OR 6283. A GENERAL DOWNWARD TREND IN ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED AS REGIONS 6272 AND 6279 WILL BE ROTATING OFF THE DISK OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS WERE REPORTED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS, BUT WITH A POSSIBILITY FOR SOME ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES ON THE FIRST DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY DAY THREE.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6314 (S17E54) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN SPOT AREA WHILE CONTINUING TO PRODUCE THE MAJORITY OF THE DAYS EVENTS. A C1/SF FLARE FROM THIS AREA AT 10/0654Z WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP AND MODEST RADIO EMISSIONS AT 410MHZ. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD, AN M1/SN FLARE AT 10/1804Z, WAS ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA. REGIONS 6311 (N14E41) AND 6312 (N10E46) HAVE BECOME INCREASINGLY ACTIVE DURING THE PERIOD WITH SOME GROWTH NOTED. THE REMAINING REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE GENERALLY STABLE. NEW REGION 6318 (S15W00) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6314 CONTINUES AS THE BEST SOURCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-FLARE.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. SIGNIFICANT GROWTH WAS NOTED IN REGION 6312 (N09E32). INTERACTION BETWEEN THIS REGION AND 6311 (N14E26) TO ITS NORTH MAY HAVE HELPED IN PRODUCING THE M1/1N FLARE NOTED IN 6312 AT 11/0741Z. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 6314 (S18E40) REMAINED GENERALLY STABLE. A MODEST SEGMENT OF FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR S28W55 DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 11/0300-1354Z. WEAK SURGING WAS NOTED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB POSSIBLY SIGNALING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6272 (S13, L103) WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL M-EVENTS DURING ITS LAST ROTATION. NEW REGIONS 6319 (S26E36) AND 6320 (N06W66) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE. WHILE GENERALLY C-CLASS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DOMINATE, REGION 6312 OR 6314 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-FLARE.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6321 (S23E25) PRODUCED THE DAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE, AN M2/1N AT 0135Z. LATER IT GENERATED A C8/1N WITH TYPE II AT 0246Z. ELSEWHERE, FREQUENT SUBFLARES HAVE BEEN THE ORDER OF THE DAY IN REGIONS 6322 (S07E35) AND 6316 (N17W52), BOTH OF WHICH HAVE GROWN SUBSTANTIALLY IN WHITE LIGHT. ABUTTED REGIONS 6311 (N15W29) AND 6312 (N10W22) HAVE ALSO YIELDED MANY SMALL FLARES. NEW REGIONS 6324 (N08E06) AND 6325 (S13E55) WERE NUMBERED, BRINGING THE TOTAL OF SPOTTED REGIONS NOW VISIBLE TO 17.

sections.text: MODERATE. THE BACKGROUND SOFT X-RAY FLUX IS ABOVE THE C1 LEVEL AND THE ABUNDANCE OF FLARE-PRODUCING REGIONS MAKES ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY LIKELY. REGION 6321 OFFERS THE BEST CHANCE OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE MOST NOTABLE FEATURE OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS A MARKED INCREASE IN X-RAY AND 10.7 BACKGROUND LEVELS. X-RAY FLUX LEVELS WERE RUNNING AT OR ABOVE C3 FOR MUCH OF THE DAY IN COMPARISON TO C1 YESTERDAY. THE 10.7 FLUX JUMPED FROM 195 TO 221. EVIDENCE SUGGESTS THAT THE ENHANCE- NMENT IS A RESULT OF AN INCREASE IN OUTPUT FROM REGIONS 6327 (N16E43) AND 6331 (N17E63). TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE EVENT WAS A C7/SN FROM REGION 6322 (S08W19) AT 1014Z. FREQUENT ADDITIONAL SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD, MOSTLY FROM REGIONS 6322 AND 6327, ALTHOUGH 6311 (N15W78) ALSO MADE SOME CONTRI- BUTIONS.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM EITHER REGION 6322 OR REGION 6237.

sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  THE LARGEST EVENT WAS A C4 FROM REGION 6331 (N18E10) AT 23/1621UT.  THIS REGION AND REGION 6327 (N18W10) REMAIN THE LARGEST ON THE DISK. sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  THE DSF OF 19 OCT AND A FAVORABLY LOCATED CORONAL HOLE ARE EXPECTED TO RAISE ACTIVITY LEVELS OVER THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6350 (S24W15) STARTED OFF THE PERIOD WITH AN M1/2B FLARE AT 05/2312Z FOLLOWED BY ISOLATED SUBFLARING THEREAFTER. REGIONS 6345 (S05W47) AND 6347 (S18W20) BOTH CONTINUED TO DECAY WITH OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARING ATTRIBUTED TO 6347. REGION 6358 (N17E46) EXHIBITED MODEST GROWTH WHILE MAINTAINING AN ENHANCED PLAGE FIELD THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE PERIOD. A C6/SF FLARE AT 06/1022Z WAS THE LARGEST EVENT OBSERVED FROM THIS AREA. A 28 DEGREE LONG SEGMENT OF FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM NEAR S48E33 PRIOR TO 0707Z TODAY. AN M3/2B FLARE FROM REGION 6361 (N07E66) AT 06/2052Z CLOSED OUT THE PERIOD. THIS NEWLY EMERGED REGION DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT OVERNIGHT GROWTH. NEW REGION 6364 (S29E63) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6361 (N08W10) PRO- DUCED THE MAJORITY OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY, INCLUDING TODAY'S LARG- EST EVENT, A C9/SN AT 11/2203Z. THE REGION APPEARS TO BE DECAY- ING SOMEWHAT, BUT CONTINUES TO BE MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND FLARE PRODUCTIVE. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON WEST LIMB AT S20 (LOCATION OF EXITING REGION 6347) BETWEEN 1430 AND 1522Z. REGION 6364 (S31W08) SHOWED STEADY GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD BUT PRODUCED ONLY SMALL FLARES. REGION 6358 (N16W33) CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK BUT COULD ONLY PRODUCE ONE SUB- FLARE. NEW REGION 6368 (N19E78) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AS A SIMPLE H-TYPE GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW, BUT WITH A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE, PRIMARILY DUE TO REGION 6361. REGIONS 6364 AND 6358 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY WITH OCCASIONAL SMALL FLARES.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN IMPULSIVE M1/SN PRODUCED BY REGION 6361 (N07W22) AT 0445Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES AND IS STILL MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX BUT APPEARS TO BE SLOWLY DECAYING. THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK IS NOW REGION 6368 (N20E70), CURRENTLY ESTIMATED TO BE A 670 MIL- LIONTHS D-TYPE GROUP, ALTHOUGH MORE PLAGE AND SPOTS APPEAR TO BE ROTATING INTO VIEW. THE GROUP DID NOT PRODUCE ANY FLARES. ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES WERE PRODUCED BY A VARIETY OF REGIONS, NOTABLY A C7/1F FROM 6358 AT 1133Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE COMBINED PROBABILITIES OF M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY FROM REGIONS 6361, 6358, 6364 AND 6368 PROVIDE A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6366 (S22W09) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT: AN C3/SF AT 0929Z. THE GROUP HAS GROWN RAPIDLY FROM YESTERDAY'S SIMPLE B-TYPE CONFIGURATION INTO A SMALL D-TYPE GROUP WITH A SMALL DELTA CONFIGURATION AND BRIGHT PLAGE. REGION 6368 (N18E63) HAS ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A VERY LARGE FKI GROUP (1300 MILLIONTHS) AND PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE GROUP APPEARS TO BE HAVE A SIMPLE NORTH-SOUTH INVERSION LINE WITH AN EAST-WEST KINK BETWEEN SOME SMALL CENTRAL SPOTS. A 19 DEGREE FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR N21E25 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME BETWEEN 1810Z AND 2154Z YESTERDAY (13 NOVEMBER). REGION 6361 (N09W35) CONTINUES DECAY GRADUALLY, PRODUCING OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE PRIMARY THREATS FOR M-CLASS FLARES ARE REGIONS 6366 AND 6368, WITH A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY ALSO FROM 6361. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY FOR A MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6368 IF SOME KIND OF TRIGGER MECHANISM CAN DEVELOP IN THE GROUP.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. AN INCREASE IS POSSIBLE LATE ON THE THIRD DAY AS A RESPONSE TO TODAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT EVENT.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6368 (N18E51) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT: A C6/SF AT 1520Z. THE GROUP NOW APPEARS TO BE A LARGE FKI (2360 MILLIONTHS), WITH A SIMPLE NORTH SOUTH INVERSION LINE. THE REGION PRODUCED A FEW ADDITIONAL C- CLASS SUBFLARES. AN ADDITIONAL SOURCE OF ACTIVITY WAS REGION 6366 (S21W22), WHICH PRODUCED A NUMBER OF SMALL FLARES. THE GROUP IS QUITE SMALL (50 MILLIONTHS) BUT POSSESSES A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION WHICH APPEARS TO BE THE CAUSE OF THE FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 6358 (N17W72) PRODUCED A C5/1F AT 0529Z.

sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN THREAT FOR M-FLARES IS REGION 6368. THE REG- ION POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR MAJOR FLARES AS WELL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6368 (N18E38) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT: A C7/SF AT 0224Z. THE REGION IS DEVELOPING SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AS IT CONTINUES TO GROW (NOW AN FKI BETA-GAMMA-DELTA OF 2560 MILLIONTHS AREA). A DELTA CONFIGURATION HAS DEVELOPED IN THE WESTERN PORTION OF THE LARGE TRAILER SPOT, SHOWING A CHANGE OF 400 GAUSS OVER ABOUT 3 DE- GREES. A SECOND WEAKER DELTA APPEARS TO BE FORMING JUST SOUTH OF THE LARGE NEGATIVE LEADER SPOT, FORMING AN EAST-WEST INVER- SION LINE THAT COULD DEVELOP SHEAR OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. NONETHELESS THE REGION HAS ONLY PRODUCED C-CLASS FLARES AND POSSESSES ONLY INTENSITY 2 TO OCCASIONALLY INTENSITY 3 PLAGE. THE OTHER REGIONS WERE RELATIVELY QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH REGION 6368 THE EXPECTED SOURCE OF THE ACTIVITY. IN PARTICULAR, IF THE NEW FLUX CONTINUES TO EMERGE, OR IF SHEAR CAN DEVELOP IN THE LEADING PORTION OF THE REGION, A MAJOR FLARE IS LIKELY TO OCCUR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD GRADUALLY BECAME AC- TIVE BEGINNING AT ABOUT 03Z AND LASTING THROUGH THE REMAIND- ER OF THE DAY. THE DISTURBANCE WAS MOST LIKELY A RESULT OF THE 19 DEGREE FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON 13 NOVEMBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT ACTIVE LEVELS THROUGH ABOUT MID-DAY TOMORROW, AND IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO UNSETTLED WITH OC- CASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS THEREAFTER. RECURRENT EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE MAY INCREASE ACTIVITY SOMEWHAT, BEGINNING LATE ON THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6368 (N19E25) PRODUCED THREE M CLASS FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY- AN M1/1N AT 16/2351Z, M1/SN AT 17/1848Z, AND M2/SF AT 17/1946Z. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL C CLASS FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  NEW REGIONS 6371 (N18W17) AND 6372 (S17E66) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD DUE TO A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6368 (N18E13) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE SMALL M CLASS FLARES (AN M1/SN AT 18/0022Z AND AN M1/1N AT 18/1814Z) IN ADDITION TO SEVERAL C CLASS FLARES. THE REGION REMAINS COMPLEX ALTHOUGH THE RATE OF GROWTH HAS DECREASED AND SIGNS OF FRAGMENTATION OF THE TRAILER SPOTS IS EVIDENT.  AT LEAST TWO DELTA CONFIGURATIONS ARE STILL PRESENT IN THE TRAILER SPOT COMPLEX.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED INCLUDE 6373 (N10W17), 6374 (N21W13), AND 6375 (N21E34).

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THERE WERE THREE M-CLASS FLARES THE PAST 24 HOURS. ALTHOUGH ONLY THE LARGEST, AN M3/1N AT 0954UT WAS OPTICALLY CORRELATED, IT IS VERY DOUBTFUL THAT EITHER OF THE OTHER TWO CAME FROM SOMEWHERE OTHER THAN REGION 6368 (N13W02). A DELTA CONFIGURATION REMAINS IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE REGION, BUT MAGNETIC ANALYSIS SUGGESTS THAT IT IS WEAKENING. ADDITIONAL FRAGMENTATION AND SLIGHT SIZE REDUCTION TODAY MAY INDICATE THAT THE REGION HAS BEGUN ITS DECAY PROCESS. NEW REGION 6376 (S18W19) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE. THERE IS STILL A FAIR CHANCE OF A MAJOR FLARE, HOWEVER, IT IS EXPECTED TO BE ISOLATED. IF A MAJOR FLARE WERE TO OCCUR, IT IS MOST LIKELY THAT IT WOULD ORIGINATE IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. IT APPEARS THAT THE ACTIVITY EXPECTED FROM THE CORONAL HOLE HAS FAILED TO MATERIALIZE.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED THE FIRST DAY OF THE PERIOD. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD DOMINATE THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

THE SECOND WAS AN M1/1F FLARE AT 25/1905Z, ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. THE LEADER PORTION OF 6368 HAS ALREADY CROSSED THE WEST LIMB. A POSSIBLE SOURCE FOR THIS ACTIVITY MAY BE NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6395 (N16E73), A LARGE SPOT AREA WHICH EMERGED TODAY FROM THE NORTHEAST LIMB WHERE FREQUENT SURGING HAD BEEN NOTED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THIS SPOT AREA MAY BE RETURNING OLD REGION 6358 (N16, L-151) WHICH PRODUCED NUMEROUS C-CLASS EVENTS DURING ITS LAST ROTATION. OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES FROM REGIONS 6388 (S06W10) AND 6390 (N35E48) ROUNDED OUT THE PERIOD. NEW REGIONS 6394 (N05W59) AND 6396 (S22W34) WERE ALSO ASSIGNED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6397 (N09E44) PRODUCED AN M6/1F FLARE AT 04/0203Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 310 SFU TENFLARE. THERE WERE NO RADIO SWEEP BURSTS OR MAJOR DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE. THUS FAR, THIS REGION HAS DISPLAYED NO SIGNIFICANT GROWTH AND THE OBSERVED MAGNETIC GRADIENTS HAVE BEEN CHARACTERIZED AS GENERALLY WEAK. REGION 6397 ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/1B FLARE AT 04/1439, ALSO ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 6400 (S24W62) BEGAN PRODUCING FREQUENT SUBFLARES LATE IN THE PERIOD, NONE OF WHICH WERE ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT X-RAY BURSTS. NEW REGION 6403 (S25E14) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  ONLY SMALL C CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED.  MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY HAS COME FROM REGION 6400 (S24W90) AND THE REGION 6395 (N17E11)/6397 (N10E18) COMPLEX. REGION 6400 IS GROWING AND PRODUCING SMALL SURGES AS IT MAKES ITS WEST LIMB TRANSIT.  INTERIOR SPOTS HAVE EMERGED IN REGIONS 6395 AND 6397 AND A SMALL DELTA WAS REPORTED IN 6395. A DELTA WAS ALSO REPORTED IN REGION 6387 (S23W26).  REGION 6404 (S18E25) EMERGED AND IS GROWING SLOWLY.  REGIONS 6405 (S11E58) AND 6406 (S24E57) WERE ASSIGNED, BOTH ARE SMALL SPOT GROUPS IN SCATTERED PLAGE.  CORONAL HOLE 61, LOCATED IN THE NORTH EAST, APPEARS TO EXTEND TO THE SOLAR NORTH POLE.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR ACTIVITY ARE THE 6395/6397 COMPLEX, REGION 6387, AND THE SOUTH WEST LIMB AREA.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN M1/1F FLARE AT 1411Z FROM REGION 6397 (N10E05). THIS REGION CONTINUES TO GROW AND IS CURRENTLY THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK. IT SHOWS SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6387 (S24W40) PRODUCED FREQUENT SMALL C-CLASS FLARES, BUT IS NO LONGER GROWING. SOME GROWTH WAS OBSERVED FROM 6404 (S18E12) BUT IT ONLY PRODUCED ONE C-CLASS SUBFLARE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.text: MODERATE.  REGION 6397 IS  THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR ACTIVITY ALTHOUGH THOUGH REGION 6395 (N17W02) MIGHT ALSO BE A SOURCE FOR M-FLARES GIVEN ITS SIZE AND PROXIMITY TO 6397. OLD REGION 6368 (N17, L-025), WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT, IS DUE TO RETURN ON 10 DECEMBER AND IS LIKELY TO INCREASE BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS. IT MAY ALSO PROVE TO BE AN ADDITIONAL SOURCE FOR SOLAR ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6398 (N15W57) PRO- DUCED AN M5/2B FLARE (TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE) AT 0754Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP (SHOCK VELOCITY 1400 KM/S), A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP AND WEAK DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THIS RELATIVELY SMALL GROUP (180 MILLIONTHS) PRODUCED THE MAJORITY OF TODAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY, APPARENTLY DUE TO ITS COMPLEX MAGNETIC INVERSION LINE. THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF FREQUENT C-CLASS SUBFLARES FROM A NUMBER OF REGIONS. REGIONS 6397 (N09W34) AND 6310 (N05E58) ARE CURRENT- LY THE LARGEST GROUPS ON THE DISK BUT HAVE BEEN WERE FAIRLY STABLE. OLD REGION 6368 RETURNED TODAY AS AN H-TYPE SPOT (SO FAR) WITH INTENSITY 1-2 PLAGE AND WAS ASSIGNED 6412 (N19E80).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARES FROM REGIONS 6397 AND 6398. REGION 6410 (N05E58), WHICH PRODUCED AN M2 FLARE YESTERDAY IS ALSO A POSSIBLE SOURCE FOR M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TOMORROW AND FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE SECOND DAY. AN INCREASE IS EXPECTED DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE SECOND DAY AND LASTING THROUGH THE THIRD DAY IN RE- SPONSE TO TODAY'S M5 SOLAR FLARE. THE LEVEL OF DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. EFFECTS FROM A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY ON THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH DUE TO AN M6 FLARE THAT STARTED AT 2042Z, ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 2052Z AND ENDED AT 2107Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. AN OP- TICAL CORRELATION COULD NOT BE MADE UNAMBIGUOUSLY, SINCE REGIONS 6397 (N10W52), 6402 (S11W83), AND 6387 (S23W93) WERE ALL REPORT- ED TO BE FLARING DURING THE EVENT. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARE AC- TIVITY OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD: AN M1/SF FROM 6387 (S23W93) AT 0508Z, AN M1/1N AT 1153Z AND AN M1/SF AT 1819Z FROM 6398 (N15W71). THE MATURE REGIONS IN THE NORTHWEST, 6395 (N19E55), 6397 (N10W52) AND 6398 (N15W71), APPEARED TO BE ON THE DECLINE, ALTHOUGH THEY CERTAINLY PRODUCED NUMEROUS C-CLASS SUBFLARES IN ADDITION TO THE EVENTS MENTIONED EARILIER. REGION 6402 (S11W83) ALMOST DOUBLED IN SIZE TODAY, AND PRODUCED NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARES (THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C5). THE NORTHEAST PART OF THE DISK WAS ALSO OF INTEREST TODAY WITH THREE MAJOR SPOTS NOW VISIBLE AS FOLLOWS: A SMALL H-TYPE AT N24E66 ASSIGNED 6413, A LARGE H-TYPE AT N20E75 ASSIGNED 6412 WHICH IS THE RETURN OF OLD 6368, AND ANOTHER LARGE H-TYPE SPOT NEAR N18E89. THE LATTER MAY BE THE TRAILING PORTION OF OLD 6368 BUT ITS PROXIMITY TO THE LIMB PREVENTED THIS DETERMINATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN THREATS FOR M-CLASS FLARES APPEAR TO BE RE- GIONS 6398 AND 6397, ALTHOUGH 6410, 6412 OR 6402 MIGHT ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY. THERE IS A SLIGHT-FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. A GRADUAL DOWNWARD TREND IN ACTIVITY LEVELS IS ANTICIPATED WITH THE DEPARTURE OF 6387, 6402, AND 6398 OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET UNTIL SOMETIME MID TO LATE IN THE DAY TO- MORROW. AN INCREASE IS EXPECTED AT THAT TIME, LASTING THROUGH DAY 2 WITH MID-LATITUDES TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS AND HIGH LAT- ITUDES TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THE MAJOR SOLAR FLARE OF 10 DECEMBER, WITH ADDITIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS POSSIBLE FROM A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS BY DAY 3.

sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  THERE WERE A TOTAL OF EIGHT M-CLASS FLARES. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS AN M8/SF AT 1410UT FROM REGION 6398 (N15W83). EARLIER A MAJOR FLARE ERUPTED FROM REGION 6399 (N21W82), THIS FLARE WAS AN M5/SF AT 0803UT. REGION 6399 WAS THE TODAY'S BIGGEST PRODUCER, WITH FIVE M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6410 (N05E32) DISPLAYED SUBSTANTIAL GROWTH AND INCREASED ACTIVITY TODAY. THE REGION ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB AT N18 YESTERDAY, WAS COMBINED WITH REGION 6412 (N17E66) AS THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE REGION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6398, 6399, 6410 AND 6412 ARE MOST LIKELY TO PRODUCE THE MODERATE ACTIVITY. ANY OF THESE REGIONS ARE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ALSO. THE GENERAL TREND OF ACTIVITY SHOULD BE ON THE DECLINE AS THE GROUP OF REGIONS IN THE NORTHEAST ROTATES OFF THE DISK.

REGION 6412 SHOWS BOTH SPOT AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. DELTA CONFIGURATIONS HAVE FORMED IN THE LEADER AND TRAILER SPOTS. VECTOR MAGNETOGRAPH DATA SHOWS SOME MAGNETIC SHEARING IN THE SOUTH EAST PORTION OF THE TRAILER SPOTS. REGION 6410 (N05E07) SHOWS SOME SPOT COMPLEXITY BUT IS A SIMPLE BETA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6412 (N17E22) PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 15/0544Z. THIS REGION GREW SLOWLY AND SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY WAS EVIDENT. FREQUENT SUBFLARES EMANATED FROM THE TRAILER PLAGE. REGION 6410 (N04W05) ALSO GREW SLOWLY BUT EXHIBITED LITTLE FLARE ACTIVITY. A BRIGHT SURGE AND AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE TO 0.32R WERE SEEN BETWEEN 15/0206- A0301Z WHERE REGION 6395 ROTATED OVER THE LIMB ON 14 DEC. A C3 X-RAY BURST WAS OBSERVED WITH THIS EVENT AND REACHED MAXIMUM AT 15/0212Z. A MODERATE INTENSITY TYPE IV ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT AS DID A STRONG TYPE II WITH ESTIMATED SHOCK SPEED OF 800 KM/S.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A MODERATE LEVEL FOR THE FORECAST PERIOD. REGION 6412 SHOULD BE THE PRIMARY CONTRIBUTING REGION. REGION 6410 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. THERE IS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF A MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6412.

sections.text: SHOULD BE AT QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. THE MAIN EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN X1/2B TENFLARE FROM REGION 6412 (N16W79) AT 23/0952Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST RADIO BURST EMISSIONS AND A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED ISOLATED SUBFLARES AND A C8/1N EVENT AT 23/0041Z. REGION 6415 (N13 L-032) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR AN M4/1N FLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II AND IV SWEEP FREQUENCY BURSTS AT 22/2321Z PRIOR TO ROTATING AROUND THE LIMB EARLY IN THE PERIOD. REGION 6420 (S24E44), PART OF A COMPLEX ELONGATED AREA IN THE SOUTHEAST, HAS BEEN SPLIT WITH THE LEADING PORTION NOW DESIGNATED AS NEW REGION 6423 (S20E40). 6420 HAS PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARES ALONG WITH AN M5/2B EVENT AT 22/2246Z. SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY HAS BEEN NOTED IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THIS REGION. REGION 6423 HAS PRODUCED ONLY ISOLATED SUBFLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6412 PRIOR TO ITS DEPARTURE ON THE 24TH. REGION 6420 MAY PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE MEASURING 15 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER WAS OBSERVED AT 22/2241Z. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10MEV BECAME ENHANCED AT 23/1005Z AND REACHED A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 5 PFU AT 23/1140Z WITH THE FIELD CURRENTLY RETURNING TO BACKGROUND LEVELS. THE X1/2B FLARE FROM REGION 6412 WAS THE APPARENT SOURCE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6420 (S24E18) PRODUCED THE SOLE M-FLARE OF THE PERIOD: AN M1/1F EVENT AT 24/2300Z. AFTER FURTHER ANALYSIS OF THE SPOT STRUCTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS REGION, THE DISTANT LEADING SPOT HAS NOW BEEN GROUPED WITH REGION 6423 (S17E12). BOTH REGIONS 6420 AND 6423 HAVE BEEN FAIRLY ACTIVE PRODUCING A NUMBER OF SUBFLARES AND OCCASIONAL C-CLASS EVENTS. REGION 6424 (S11E14) EXHIBITED SUSTAINED GROWTH EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT APPEARS TO BE SLOWING DOWN NOW. ISOLATED SUBFLARING WAS ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA TODAY. NEW REGION 6426 (S13E25) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6420 OR 6423 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV REMAINED SLIGHTLY ENHANCED ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVELS IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM THE 24 DECEMBER X1/1B FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM THE RECENT X-CLASS FLARING AND A CORONAL HOLE. SATELLITE LEVELS PROTONS SHOULD CONTINUE TO RETURN TO BACKGROUND LEVELS.

sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6420 (S25E09) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR AN X1/2B TENFLARE AT 1402Z. THIS WAS AN IMPULSIVE FLARE WITH NO TYPE II OR IV RADIO SWEEPS DETECTED. EALIER IN THE PERIOD THIS REGION PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES, AN M1/1N AT 0226Z AND AN M1/1F AT 1128Z. NEW REGION 6427 (S11E74) ROTATED INTO VIEW AND WAS NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6420 REMAINS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME EFFECTS OF THE RECENT X-CLASS FLARING ARE STILL POSSIBLE THROUGH THE SECOND DAY OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. CLUSTERED REGIONS 6420 (S25W00), 6423 (S20W15), AND 6424 (S08W07) PRODUCED NEARLY ALL OF TODAY'S FLARES, THE LARGEST A C6/1N AT 1748Z FROM 6420. THE DISK HAS SEVEN SPOTTED REGIONS VISIBLE, AND THESE CAN BE DESCRIBED AS EITHER STABLE OR IN DECAY. ALTHOUGH NONE APPEARS PARTICULARLY OMINOUS, THERE ARE INTERACTIONS OCCURRING BETWEEN ADJACENT REGIONS WITH SMALL FLARES RESULTING. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED AND THE LIMBS WERE QUIET.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. OCCASIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR NEAR CENTER DISK WHERE REGIONS 6420, 6423 AND 6424 ARE LOCATED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. A STRONG RESPONSE TO THE X1/2B FLARE OF 26/1402Z IS NOT ANTICIPATED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6424 (S11W48) ERUPTED WITH THREE M-CLASS FLARES IN A FIVE HOUR SPAN: M1/0B TENFLARE AT 1321Z, M4/1B AT 1516Z, AND M1/0N AT 1832Z. THESE HOMOLOGOUS EVENTS WERE CHARACTERIZED BY VERY IMPULSIVE X RAY BURSTS LACKING THE NORMAL GRADUAL DECAY PHASE, AND MODERATE BURSTS AT RADIO FREQUENCIES ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. THE X RAY PROFILE SUGGESTS A FLARE SITE IN THE CORONA AND LITTLE CHROMO- SPHERIC HEATING. THIS REGION WAS ALSO THE SITE OF C-CLASS FLARES, AMONG THEM A C5/0N TENFLARE AT 1148Z. ELSEWHERE LITTLE OF SIGNIFICANCE OCCURRED. A NEW REGION, 6432 (S09E41), WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6424 SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE THE DOMINANT ACTIVE REGION AND ADDITIONAL ENERGETIC ACTIVITY IS LIKELY. 2IA.  GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS.
